title: victorian_romance_emma
body:
[i]Emma[/i] is a historical romance manga by [[Mori Kaoru]]. It was published by Enterbrain in the magazine Comic Beam and collected in 10 tankōbon volumes. The series has been adapted as an anime television series, entitled Emma - A Victorian Romance (Eikoku Koi Monogatari Emma). The manga is licensed in English in North America by CMX and the anime is licensed in English by Nozomi Entertainment.

Set in Victorian London at the end of the 19th century, Emma is the story of a maid who falls in love with a member of the gentry. However, the young man's family disapproves of him associating with people of the lower classes.

h4. Characters

* [[Emma (Victorian Romance Emma)]]
* [[William Jones]]
* [[Richard Jones]]

title: nixie_tube
body:
An electronic device developed in the 1950's for displaying numerals or other information using glow discharge.  They're a glass tube filled with a low-pressure gas, such as neon, and contains a wire-mesh anode and multiple cathodes shaped like numerals or symbols.  Applying power to a specific cathode surrounds it with an orange glow discharge.

The technology was superseded in the 1970's by light-emitting diodes (LED's), vacuum fluorescent displays (VFD's) and liquid-crystal displays (LCD's). However, similar to vinyl record enthusiasts, there remains a substantial number of electrical hobbyists who consider them visually superior to their successors. A common project for such hobbyists is to create a digital clock using Nixie tubes scavenged from vintage electrical equipment.

h4. See also

* [[Steins;Gate]] - a Nixie tube numerical display features prominently
* [[Vacuum tube]] (a device of similar appearance)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia - Nixie Tube":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nixie_tube]

title: viper_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of [[Exotic (nikke)|]] together with [[Crow (Nikke)|]] and [[Jackal (Nikke)|]]. She's the staff officer of [[Exotic (nikke)|]]. She can manipulate any human with her verbal trickery and physical beauty.

She has [[pink eyes| pink]]/[[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]]/[[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] with [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[hair intakes]]. She has [[horns]] and [[earrings]] and wears a [[mouth mask]] which she usually pulls [[mask pull|down]]. She wears a [[crop top]] with a [[zipper]] and a [[chest harness]], showing her [[cleavage]] and [[bare shoulders]]. She wears [[white gloves| white]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[fingerless gloves]] sometimes showing off her [[nail polish|polished]] nails, and also a [[pink jacket]]. She wears a [[chain]], [[fishnet pantyhose]], a [[holographic clothing|holographic]] [[pleated skirt]] and [[white boots|white]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[ankle boots]]. Also wears a [[black collar]] with a [[heart collar|heart]] on it, slightly above or underneath said collar she wears a [[choker]].

Illustrator: [[Dore (gilles dore)|DORE]]

h4. Appearance

* !asset #26552533: Default

title: gaplant_hrairoo
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It first appeared in [[Advance of Zeta]].

[b]ORX-005 Gaplant TR-5 [Hrairoo][/b]

A customized variant of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] [[Gaplant]] meant to be used for testing purposes by the [[titans_test_team_(gundam)|Titans Test Team]]. The type's excessive stress on pilots was alleviated by removing the shoulder binders, which would later be reattached once the unit was deemed fit to be piloted by less exceptional physical specimens. 

As with many other Titans Test Team [[mobile_suit|MS]], it would be repainted in a white and grey scheme and receive provisions for a multitude of optional attachments - chief among them the gigantic [Fiver] hypersonic assault unit, which this type would serve as the core of.

title: hayato_kobayashi
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. He first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] series from 1979.

[b]Hayato Kobayashi[/b] is the young [[Japan]]ese pilot of the [[Guntank]] and [[Guncannon]] [[mobile suit]]s during The One Year War. He also appears later in [[Zeta Gundam]] and [[Gundam ZZ]], where he is now a high ranking [[aeug|Karaba]] officer. 

[spoilers]After the events of the original Gundam, Hayato married [[Fraw Bow]] who became pregnant with his child, and adopted orphans [[Katz Howan]], [[Letz Cofan]], and [[Kikka Kitamoto]].[/spoilers]
 
[spoilers]In Gundam ZZ Hayato dies during the First Neo Zeon War while piloting a [[Dodai Kai]] in [[battle]] against [[Rakan Dahkaran]] (who used a [[Zaku III]]) at the destroyed city of Dublin while defending refugees from a [[Colony Drop]] attack by [[Neo Zeon]].[/spoilers]

h4. See also

* [[Mobile Suit Guntank]]

title: goddess_of_victory:_nikke
body:
A Korean mobile third-person shooter role-playing game, developed by [[Shift Up]] and published by Level Infinite, a subsidiary of Tencent. Development began as early as 2017 and being officially released on November 4, 2022 for [[Android (os)|]] and [[iOS (os)|]], and on February 15, 2023 for the PC port.

Players are put into the shoes of a [[commander (nikke)|]] of advanced androids called "Nikkes" and are tasked with fighting back against [[Rapture (nikke)|]]s, mysterious robotic organisms that have driven humanity underground following a devastating war, and reclaiming the surface.

One of the popular abbreviations for the game's title in Japanese is メガニケ (MegaNikke; with mega being the short for 女神, megami).

h4. See also

* [[Destiny Child]]
* [[Stellar Blade]]
* [[Nikke's shooting pose (meme)|]]
* [[List of Goddess of Victory: Nikke characters]]

title: multiple_views
body:
Two or more different pictures of the same character in an image. These can be the same character from different viewpoints, in different outfits, in different poses, or any combination.

This tag doesn't apply to [[zoom layer]] unless the zoom layer image is different from the foreground image. It also doesn't apply to [[comic]]s, as they generally always have multiple views.

Images with this tag should not be tagged [[solo]].

For depictions of characters that feature a duplicate of themselves, see the [[dual persona]] and [[clone]] tags.

title: loki_(fire_emblem)
body:
Loki is an antagonist from [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. She is first introduced by apparently disguising herself as Bruno, Anna, Alfonse, and Sharena. She initially keeps her true form hidden, but appears as her true self in Book II of the main story. Capricious, sultry and playful, Loki shows a consistent inclination toward chaos, with her true motivations remaining unknown.

In reality, Loki is a goddess who serves [[Alfathor (Fire Emblem)|Alfaðör]], the creator god of the setting, together with her sister [[Thorr (Fire Emblem)|Thórr]]. [[Heimdallr (fire emblem)|]], a fellow goddess, is Loki's arch-rival.

After a long absence, she returns in Book IX with [[Loki (Trickster God) (Fire Emblem)|a new design]], which had previously been introduced in April 2024 for her Mythic alt.

h4. Appearance

title: lyn_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade]], and one of the three Lords of the game along with [[Eliwood (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Hector (Fire Emblem)|]].

Full name Lyndis, a Sacaean swordswoman, her own quest comprises the tutorial mode of the game, and has her claim her birthright as a Lycian noble. She has [[green eyes]] and [[very long hair|long]] [[green hair]] usually in a [[ponytail]]. [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] also tends to portray her as being [[large_breasts|large-chested]].

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 1 of the 2017's edition of Choose Your Legends (Fire Emblem Heroes' popularity poll), making her the first overall winner of CYL.

Voiced by [[Oomoto Makiko]] in Japanese and [[Wendee Lee]] in English.

title: veronica_(fire_emblem)
body:
Veronica is a primary antagonist of [i][[Fire Emblem Heroes]][/i]. She is a young princess of the Emblian Empire. She aims to destroy the Askran Kingdom by manipulating heroes from other worlds.

Remarkably, she was chosen as one of the winners of the 2018's Edition of Choose Your Legends (the game's popularity poll), being second place from the Women's Division; making her the first Heroes Original Character to get a Brave Unit.

A young thief native of Daein; he is first seen in Path of Radiance in a Crimean port searching for his [[Micaiah_(fire_emblem)|friend]] that disappeared from Daein recently. He can also befriend [[Astrid (Fire Emblem)|]] or [[Tormod (Fire Emblem)|]] via supports.

Later returns as a young adult in Radiant Dawn, where he is also one of the main characters.

title: bruno_(fire_emblem)
body:
Bruno, initially identified as the Mysterious Man, is a secondary antagonist in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]]. He is an enigmatic man who occasionally appears before the Order of Heroes.

He is a prince of Embla, he and his mother were despised by the royal family. Eventually claiming she shared imperial secrets with Askr, they imprisoned her, causing her to die in isolation, while he himself was banished to the border despite only being a child.

In his first appearance in Chapter 9, he faces the Order of Heroes at first, but eventually aids them, as he warns about Veronica's attack on their summoning grounds. Later, he claims to have knowledge about Zacharias, but refuses to say anything more before disappearing.

[spoilers]In reality, he IS Zacharias, which was an alias used by Bruno to get closer to the Askran royal family.[/spoilers]

h4. Appearance

* !post #2603233: Default
* !post #7074508: Unmasked

title: 8chan
body:
8chan was an anonymous [[imageboard]] website founded by Fredrick Brennan in 2013 (eventually acquired by Jim Watkins in 2016) which allowed users to create their own boards for specific topics. The site was the subject of various controversies over the years up  until its closure in 2019 following a series of mass shooting in the [[United States]] linked to some of the boards on it. 8chan would return on November 5, 2019 as "8kun".

h4. See also

* [[4chan]]
* [[Futaba Channel]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: 8chan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/8chan

title: deep_impact_(umamusume)
body:
An unimplemented [[Umamusume]] character, based on [[deep impact (racehorse)|the racehorse of the same name]].

The real life [i]Deep Impact[/i] was an obvious short-lister for the franchise, having made a tentative appearance in a [[2016 umamusume promotional video|2016 promotional video]]. However, due to the alleged controversy arising from the franchise's bastardization of [[King Kamehameha (umamusume)|]] (which share the same owner, Makoto Kaneko), he and Kaneko's other horses are unlikely to officially appear beyond allusions made in-game.

So far, seven of his progeny appears in the franchise: 
* [[Satono Diamond (umamusume)|]] (2016 Kikuka Sho, Arima Kinen)
* [[Verxina (umamusume)|]] (2nd place in all Triple Tiara races in 2012; 2013, 2014 Victoria Mile)
* [[Vivlos (umamusume)|]] (2016 Shuka Sho, 2017 Dubai Turf)
* [[Gentildonna (umamusume)|]] (2012 Triple Tiara, 2012, 2013 Japan Cup, 2014 Dubai Sheema, 2014 Arima Kinen)
* [[Gran Alegria (umamusume)|]] (2019 Oka Sho, 2020, 2021 Mile Championship, 2020 Yasuda Kinen, 2020 Sprinters Stakes, 2021 Victoria Mile)
* [[Loves Only You (umamusume)|]] (2019 Oaks, 2021 QEII Cup, HK Cup, BC Filly & Mare Turf)
* [[Curren Bouquetd'or (umamusume)|]] (No G1s, 2019 Sweetpea Stakes (Listed), 2nd in all 2019 Triple Tiara races).
other_names: ディープインパクト(ウマ娘)

title: eldlich_the_golden_lord
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]]. The boss monster of the Eldlich archtype, which later became (in)famous for extensive usage of various floodgate cards to restrict the opponents.

Eldlich is a four-eyed monstrous zombie overlord wearing ornate golden armor.

He is often paired with [[Laundry Dragonmaid]] due to a series of fanarts by [[Hatano Kiyoshi]] featuring them and their supposed synergy.

Despite his evil overlord personality, his fanarts often depict him with a comically serious side, engaging in shenanigans without a hint of irony behind them.

title: george_myers
body:
George Myers is the protagonist of the second book in [[Jo Shin Ogi]]'s series, The [[Chronicle of Myers]], The Prime Minister of the Cold War. His experiences and achievements span two centuries. This character is one of few characters that appears throughout the entire series (whether as the protagonist or a supporting role).

His counterparts in [i]Chronicle of Myers: Origins[/i] are Su Dingfang, Otto the Great, William Adams (Miura Anjin), [[Otto von Bismarck]], etc. [spoiler]He would reincarnate as [[Totsuka Ayami (Chronicle of Myers)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Ogiverse Wiki: George Myers":[http://ogiverse.fandom.com/zh/wiki/乔治·迈尔斯]

title: curly_(mouthwashing)
body:
Secondary protagonist in [[Mouthwashing]]. Curly is the original captain of the Tulpar, prior to the crash and [[Jimmy (mouthwashing)|]] taking over. He was at the top of the ship's command chain and was primarily in charge of navigation.

[[curly (pre-crash) (mouthwashing)|Before the crash]], Curly was an average-built man with [[blue eyes]], light stubble, and [[curly hair| curly]] [[blonde hair]] formed into a middle part. He wore [[brown boots]] and Pony Express coveralls ([[blue jacket]] and [[blue pants]]) over a [[yellow shirt]].

[[curly (post-crash) (mouthwashing)|After the crash]], he is nearly unrecognizable; his hair, lips, and the majority of his features are burned away. He is wrapped in [[bandages]], while still exposing subcutaneous flesh and muscle. He has no hands and feet and wears a [[hospital gown]], which is [[blood on clothes|heavily blood-soaked]]. His most prominent feature are his fully exposed mouth and eyeball, which are his only facial features not covered by bandages.

title: curly_(post-crash)_(mouthwashing)
body: After the crash, [[Curly (mouthwashing)|]] is nearly unrecognizable; his hair, lips, and the majority of his features are burned away. He is wrapped in [[bandages]], while still exposing subcutaneous flesh and muscle. He has no hands and feet and wears a [[hospital gown]], which is [[blood on clothes|heavily blood-soaked]]. His most prominent feature are his fully exposed mouth and blue eyeball, which are his only facial features not covered by bandages.

Not to be confused with [[animal costume]]s, [[mascot costume]]s or [[furry|furries]]. For sex acts with stuffed toys (plushophilia), see [[teddy bear sex]].

title: killmonger
body:
Erik Killmonger (né N'Jadaka) is a supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by Don McGregor and Rich Buckler, he first appeared in Jungle Action #6 (September 1973). 

The character is commonly depicted as a skilled hunter and mercenary born in the fictional African nation of Wakanda, who holds a grudge against the country and its people after his biological parents were killed when he was young. 

Raised outside of Wakanda, he eventually returns as a revolutionary leader and terrorist to exact his revenge, and repeatedly challenges the nation's king and protector, [[Black Panther (marvel)|]], who becomes his most prominent adversary.

He is played by Michael B. Jordan in the [[Black Panther (Movie)|2018 film]] and its [[Black Panther: Wakanda Forever|2022 sequel]]

title: kinesiology_tape
body: A type of elastic fabric [[tape]] used to provide external support to muscles, either as a treatment for injury, or in an attempt to prevent same. Its effectiveness in both roles is disputed, but athletes are often seen wearing it in competition.  If an athlete is depicted with what seem like randomly placed, unusually large [[bandaid]]s on their body, especially the shoulders, back, and/or legs, that's kinesio tape.

title: fuleco
body:
Fuleco was the official mascot of the 2014 FIFA World Cup, hosted in Brazil. Fuleco is a Brazilian three-banded armadillo, a species of armadillo which is native to Brazil and categorized as a vulnerable species on the IUCN Red List. Fuleco was officially launched as part of Brazilian broadcaster TV Globo's weekly Fantástico entertainment show on 25 November 2012.

His name is a portmanteau of the Portuguese words futebol ("football") and ecologia ("ecology"). The mascot, with his message of environmental concerns, ecology and sport, turned out to be very popular with football teams around the world.

title: exusiai_(arknights)
body:
[i]Exusiai, employee of Penguin Logistics, will clear out everything in the way using her guns[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Lemuel

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]December 24[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sankta[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]159 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]2 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A bright and cheerful gunner and operator from [[penguin_logistics_(arknights)|Penguin Logistics.]] She was sent to Rhodes Island along with her teammates as a liaison, where she assists with a variety of operations. Her choice of weapon is the [[Kriss Vector]] [[submachine_gun|sub-machine gun]].

A common theme in fanart is her love of [[apple pie]], based on her combat dialogue of shouting "apple pie".

As a Sankta, her motif is an angel. She has a bright halo above her head and small energy "wings" coming out of her back at all times, regardless of her clothes.

She has an older adoptive sister named [[Lemuen (Arknights)|]], whose name inspired her name "Lemuel".

Her [[voice actor|voice actresses]] are [[Iwami Manaka]] (Japanese), Cai Shujin (Chinese), Leonora Haig (English), and Lee Ji-hyun (Korean). Her original art designer  is [[huanxiang heitu]], while her [b]Midnight Delivery[/b] outfit is drawn by [[weiyu jiang]].

title: mostima_(arknights)
body:
[i]Mostima, Senior Messenger, will lay low all obstacles in your path with her Arts.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Laterano[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]December 12[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Undisclosed[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]170 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]1 year[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A messenger employee of [[Penguin Logistics (arknights)|]] who always acts alone. Nothing is known about her previous work history before joining Penguin Logistics. She was sent to Rhodes Island as a liaison for Penguin Logistics, where she assists with a variety of operations. She uses two staves as her choice of weapons, named "Black Lock" and "White Key" which she uses to slow the nervous system of her enemies, making it feel like she's stopping time.

She is a fallen Santa, which is related to a tragic incident in her past. See [[Andoain (arknights)|]]. Her callsign itself is a reference to Mastema, who was a fallen angel in Judaism.

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Mizuki Nana]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5601086: Sports

title: semiramis_(fate)
body:
The Assassin of "Red" Servant of [[Amakusa Shirou (fate)|Shirou Kotomine]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. A woman with [[absurdly long hair|floor-length]] [[black hair]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[pointy ears]]. She wears a [[long dress|long]] [[black dress]] with [[fur trim]], and [[bridal gauntlets]] with long [[spikes]] seemingly through her palms. Her most notable Noble Phantasm -- as featured in [[Fate/Grand Order]] -- are the [[Hanging Gardens of Babylon]], repurposed as a floating base with immense firepower.

[b]True Name:[/b] Semiramis, the Wise Queen of Assyria
[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Morii Shizuki]]
[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]

title: assertive_female
body:
A milder version of [[femdom]]. A female character who is sexually assertive, in control of her partner, or romantically active. 

For sexual interactions, this is typically when the girl is [[girl on top|on top]] or clearly in control - no frowning, gaping, blank stares, etc. - often with a [[naughty face|naughty expression]]. Basically, she is screwing her partner instead of the other way around. If the partner is also shown to be enjoying it, it's also [[happy sex]]. This does not include [[pegging]].

For romantic interactions, the girl is actively displaying affections towards the partner. This does not require any agressive, sexual, femdom expressions, as long as she's the one that's initiating the interactions. If both partners take turns in activeness, this is also a [[reversible couple]].

h4. See also

* [[femdom]]
* [[power bottom]]
* Opposite: [[and so they were both bottoms (meme)]]

title: wplace
body: "wplace":https://wplace.live/ is a website designed to be a clone of [[r/place]], but instead of taking place of a [[canvas (medium)|blank canvas]], it takes place on a [[world map]], giving it trillions of pixels in drawable area. Users are able to draw one pixel every 30 seconds. The idea is to fight for dominance of the canvas before it expires and disappears. Wplace, however, seems to be a permanent installation, meaning drawings there do not expire.

body:

title: i_just_love_latinas_sonic_(meme)
body:
Originates from a [[meme]] dubbing over an episode of [[Sonic Prime]] with [[sonic the hedgehog|Sonic]] asking [[Shadow the hedgehog|Shadow]] why he wants to go to Mexico, to which Shadow responds with "I just love Latinas, Sonic".

Later a viral TikTok audio would expand on the meme, with Shadow going on a long rant about his love for Latinas:

"Shoutout to all the Latinas. The goth ones, the cowboy boot wearing ones, the crazy ones, I don't care. I see a Latina bitch with white or black toes and I start acting like a damn dog."

Intentional or unintentional to the creator of the meme, [[rouge the bat|Rouge]], a female character often seen alongside Shadow in games, has traits of Honduran white bat and designed after sex appeal of famous Latina actors like [[Jennifer Lopez]].

title: skyline
body:
The outline created by a [[city]] over the horizon, usually against the background of the [[sky]]. Major real-world cities have distinctive skylines that can serve to identify a location without having to name it.

For images without cities, use [[horizon]] instead. For the vehicle, see [[Nissan Skyline]].

title: dino_crisis
body:
A videogame series created by Mikami Shinji, the creator of [[Resident Evil]] and published by [[Capcom]]. The series involves the protagonists fighting dinosaur outbreaks as a result of scientific experiments gone wrong which transports dinosaurs from the past to the present.

The series consists three games and one spin-off which includes:

* Dino Crisis (1999)
The first game of the series. Set in 2009, the game follows a Special Operative named [[regina (dino crisis)|Regina]], whose team head to a secret facility at Ibis Island to capture Dr. Edward Kirk, a scientist who was working on a new alternative energy source called Third Energy. However, upon arriving at Ibis Island, Regina and her team discover the island overrun by deadly dinosaurs as result of Third Energy bringing them from the past.

* Dino Crisis 2 (2000)
The second game of the series. A year after the events of the first game, the fictional Edwards City disappears as result of Third Energy experiment gone wrong. Believing the city got sent in the past, a search and rescue team led by [[Dylan (dino Crisis)|Dylan]] and Regina travel through a time gate to rescue the survivors and retrieve data from the experiment. As Regina and Dylan battle more ferocious dinosaurs, they must deal with a mysterious faction of humans stopping them and learn why Edwards City got transported.

* Dino Crisis 3 (2003)
The third and final game of the series. Set in the year 2548, the game follows Patrick Tyler, an astronaut whose rescue team discover the lost colony ship, Ozymandias, only to discover the ship is infested with mutant dinosaurs.

title: anya_(spy_x_family)
body:
One of the three main characters of [[Spy x Family]].

She is a young girl who is a former experimental subject, granting [[mind reading]] abilities. 'Adopted' by [[Twilight (spy x family)|]] as part of the latter's cover identity. As such, she is also the adoptive 'stepdaughter' of [[Yor Briar]]. Can be seen with plushies, such as [[Director Chimera (spy x family)|]] and Agent Penguinman.

Has [[pink hair]] with [[hairpods]] covering [[cone hair bun]]s.

She is voiced by [[Tanezaki Atsumi]] in Japanese and Megan Shipman in English.

h4. Other names

* [b]Anya Forger:[/b] Assumed 'legal name' after being adopted by 'Loid Forger'.
* [b]Subject 007:[/b] Her 'name' during her experimental subject days.
* [b]Anya Folger:[/b] Transliteration used in some of the earlier official English translations.
* [b]Ania:[/b] Name as spelled in the original Japanese series, on occasions when Latin letter script is used. Short Mission 11 has Loid correcting her and changing it to 'Anya', to her surprise. Also name used in some of the earlier official English translations. Polish variant of "Anna"/"Anya".

h4. See also

* [[Anya's heh face (meme)]]
* [[wakuwaku (spy x family)|]]
other_names: アーニャ・フォージャー

title: precure
body:
A [[magical girl]] anime franchise created by Izumi Todo and produced by [[Toei Company]].

The [i]Pretty Cure[/i], or [i]PreCure[/i], are girls who are chosen to transform into magical girls to protect the earth. Though their origins differ throughout each series, they are always referred to as 'legendary warriors'. Whilst most later Cures are able to transform individually, some Cures, particularly in earlier series, often have to transform in pairs. Generally in each series, the girls chosen to become Pretty Cure are in middle school, though in recent series, there have been older and younger Pretty Cures as well as male Pretty Cures.

title: m250
body:
The M250 is the U.S. military designation for the SIG LMG 6.8, a 6.8×51mm (.277 in), gas-operated, belt-fed light machine gun designed by [[SIG Sauer]] for the U.S. Army's Next Generation Squad Weapon Program in 2022 to replace the [[M249 saw|M249 Squad Automatic Weapon]]. The M250's design is an offshoot of the [[sig mg338|SIG Sauer MG 338]] which SIG was also developing for SOCOM.

h4. External Links

* "IMFDB.org":https://www.imfdb.org/wiki/SIG-Sauer_MG_338: SIG Sauer MG 338 & SIG Sauer LMG 6.8/M250
* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M250_light_machine_gun

title: sig_mg338
body:
A [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] manufactured by [[SIG Sauer]], chambered for ".338 Norma Magnum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.338_Norma_Magnum [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. It was intended to bridge the firepower gap between the 7.62x51mm NATO [[machine gun]] and the [[heavy machine gun|heavier]] [[Browning M2]]. The SIG Sauer MG 338 features a quick-change barrel, an [[AR-15]]-style adjustable [[folding stock]], and usually seen with a 
proprietary [[suppressor]].

See the [[M250]] for the U.S. military designation for the SIG LMG 6.8, an offshoot of the MG 338, which SIG was also developing for SOCOM.

h4. Appearances

* !asset #31205083: The prototypes from Gen1, rear, to Gen4, front ("sigsauer.com":https://www.sigsauer.com/blog/the-objective-the-sig-mmg-338-program-tested-and-delivered-part-2)

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]
* [[M250]]
* [[MG338 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links

* "imfdb.org":https://www.imfdb.org/wiki/SIG-Sauer_MG_338: SIG Sauer MG 338 & SIG Sauer LMG 6.8/M250
* "ModernFirearms.net":https://modernfirearms.net//machineguns/u-s-a-machineguns/sig-sauer-mg-338-2/
* "Wikipedia: SIG MG 338":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sig_MG_338

title: m249_saw
body:
The American-manufactured equivalent of the FN Herstal Minimi 5.56mm air-cooled, gas-operated light [[machine gun]]. Formerly designated the M249 SAW (Squad Automatic Weapon). The M249 has a quick-change barrel and is usually provided with a [[bipod]] and either a fixed or retractable buttstock. It can use linked [[ammunition belt]]s or box magazines.

In 2022, the U.S. Army selected the SIG Sauer [[M250]] light machine gun to replace the M249 SAW.

h4. See also

* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M249_light_machine_gun
* "World.guns.ru article":http://world.guns.ru/machine/usa/m249-saw-e.html

title: boku_no_hero_academia
body:
[b]Boku no Hero Academia[/b] (僕のヒーローアカデミア [i]My Hero Academia[/i]) is a manga series by [[Horikoshi Kouhei]] that has been serialized in [[Shounen Jump]] from 2014 to 2024.

Set in a world where some people were born with "Quirk"; various types of superhuman powers, with some chose to exploit it for benevolent (as "Hero") or malevolent (as "Villain") purposes. The series follow [[Midoriya Izuku]] aka "Deku", a boy with unstable Quirk who attended the U.A. High School, a school that is specifically made for training their students into Heroes.

body:

title: lifeguard
body:
A person who supervises the safety of people at [[beach]]es, [[pool]]s, [[waterpark]]s, and the like, rescue those who are [[drowning]], and tend to those with other emergencies. They are trained in swimming and [[first aid]] and have aids that help them do their various functions.

Typically distinguished from other beachgoers by their [[red one-piece swimsuit|red]] [[red male swimwear|swimwear]] and/or the [[whistle around neck|whistles]] around their necks.

title: gundam_f90
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam F90[/b] is a 1990 [[Gundam]] franchise event that features a series of plastic models, two manga series, and a short story, serving as a prologue to the film Mobile Suit [[Gundam F91]]. 

F90 sets the stage for some of the important events that would happen in F91, and also provides important details of the UC universe since [[Char's Counterattack]]. The manga eventually spurred a tie in model kit series.

h4. Notable mecha
* [[F90 Gundam]]
* [[MSA-0120]]
* [[F90 Gundam (Mars Zeon Type)]]

h4. See also
* [[Gundam F91 Formula Report 0122]]

title: demogorgon
body:
A Demon Lord in [[Dungeons & Dragons]].

Also known by other names, such as The Sibilant Beast, Ahmon-Ibor and Siosivash, but better known as The Prince of Demons.

In [[Stranger Things]], the protagonists have named [[Demogorgon (Stranger Things)|the monster]] after this.

title: shine_post
body:

It started out with a light novel written by Rakuda (駱駝 "X Account":[https://x.com/rakuda_joro]) and illustrated by [[Buriki]]. It later expanded with a manga drawn by [[Kawasemi (Pocorit)|Kawasemi Makiko]], an anime that aired in 2022, and a game released in 2025.

title: xinjinjumin
body:
Ambiguous: xinjinjumin (Chinese: 新晋居民, meaning: "new resident") is the default username for Lofter accounts, similar to a default Pixiv stacc (user_*), not an actual name. Create your new artist entry with the proper artist name (see [[help:artists]] or ask in topic #8199 if you need help) and add your posts to that new tag instead.

See "xinjinjumin*":[/artists?search%5Bany_name_matches%5D=xinjinjumin%2A&search%5Border%5D=created_at] for a list of artists who are still using the default Lofter username.

title: zeon
body:
The [b]Principality of Zeon[/b]. A space bound [[fascist]] [[military]] antagonist faction in the [[Gundam]] franchise. 

They first appeared in the [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] anime series from 1979 and are enemies of the [[Earth Federation]]. 

This organization was heavily inspired by the [[germany|German]] [[Wehrmacht]] and [[Waffen-SS]] from [[World War II]], as well as the [[German Empire]] and the [[austria|Austro]]-[[hungary|Hungarian]] Empire of [[World War I]].

title: the_magical_princess_and_the_monster_of_krossvikki
body:
[quote][i]A completely original fantasy story that follows the interaction between two protagonists from a faraway kingdom. One is a monster who was born from a war experiment. The other, a princess who, due to a witch's curse, possessed lost magic and was held prisoner so she could become a secret weapon later in the war.[br][br]Ideas for the story's conclusion ranged from the monster turning human once more to the two being separated forever, and so on... But in the end, both lose their powers but continue living their inhuman lives.[/i][/quote]

A [[Craft Essence (fate)|]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]], available during the [[Servant Summer Festival! 2018]] event as a reward for finishing the first half of the main quest. It depicts a fluffy monster and a one-eyed young girl.

[b]Illustrator:[/b] [[toi8]]

h4. Appearance
* !post #9019006
other_names: クロスビッキの魔法姫と怪物

title: kagayake!_grail_live!!
body:
[b]Bedazzled! Grail Concert!! ~Crane Returns an Idol's Favor~[/b]
[quote]The newly discovered minute Singularity is set in a skybound city floating far above Tokyo... This city, which echoes with the sounds of music, is filled with passionate fans who worship their favorite idols, while the idols themselves compete for the top spot.

The idols' singing...can you hear it too? Their songs sway the audience's hearts, stirring the listeners to intense fervor. Idols possess incredible power within this city, surpassing even Servants.

"Only an idol can beat an idol."

The newly established Chaldea Productions has begun to work with its first idol. Preparations are now complete. Now you and I can begin working together to produce shining, sparkling, wonderful idols, and strive to reach the top spot in the glorious "Grail Concert!"[/quote]

A limited time collaboration event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] with [[Fate/Grand Order Waltz in the Moonlight/Lostroom]], released on the Japanese server on April 26, 2021 and on the NA server on April 17, 2023. [[Mysterious Idol X Alter (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event.

h4. Craft Essences
* !post #4520950: Flower Sunshine
* !post #9051417: Chaldea Stars
* !post #4520958: Camelot Lesson
* !post #9051452: Blossoming Under the Crimson Sky

title: fuuma_kotarou_(fate)
body:
An Assassin-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Tenma Otogizoushi Onigashima]] event. He has red hair that [[hair over eyes|covers his eyes]]. He is the fifth leader of the Fuuma clan, and is known as [b]Fuuma "Evil-wind" Kotarou[/b] in the English localization. [[Katou Danzou (fate)|]] raised him as a foster son.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Sasaki Shounen]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Hanae Natsuki]]

title: essex_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the US Navy aircraft carrier USS [i]Essex[/i] (CV-9) in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Kexue]], voiced by [[Mizuhashi Kaori]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] tied into a pair of [[twintails]], [[medium breasts]], and [[brown eyes]]. Her uniform is a low cut [[blue dress]] with red and white accents as well as "Essex" written vertically along her front-left, and a red [[necktie]]. Over this is an open [[blue cloak]] with vertical slits along the full length of the sides along her arms to reach through. She wears a pair of [[black pantyhose]], and a pair of [[boots]] with red and white stripes on the top flaps.

Her [[rigging]] is composed of a [[crossbow]] with a mini [[flight deck]] on top marked "9," and two mounted flight decks. Comparing these to [[Intrepid (Azur Lane)|]], it is likely these split along the width at point about halfway along the length of the flight deck.

Her [[chibi]] [[essex face|face]] became somewhat of a meme inside community.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3253827: Default
* !post #9795041: [[Essex (Retrofit) (Azur Lane)|Retrofit/kai]] 
* !post #3639439: [[Essex (A Trip Down Route 66) (Azur Lane)|A Trip Down Route 66]]
* !post #4117736: [[Essex (Craft Fairytail) (Azur Lane)|Craft Fairytail]]
* !post #4342626: [[Essex (Brush And Ink) (Azur Lane)|Brush And Ink]]
* !post #5615161: [[essex (detective essex) (azur lane)|Detective Essex]]
* !post #6446079: [[essex (crossbones especial) (azur lane)|Crossbones Especial]]
* !post #6724756: [[essex (the gale of course 88) (azur lane)|The Gale of Course 88]]

h4. Alternative versions

* !post #7005054: [[essex (meta) (azur lane)|META version]] (currently unplayable) 

h4. Essex-class Aircraft Carriers

* [b]Essex[/b] (CV-9)
* [[Yorktown II (Azur Lane)|Yorktown]] (CV-10)
* [[Intrepid (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-11)
* [[Hornet II (Azur Lane)|Hornet]] (CV-12)
* [[Franklin (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-13)
* [[Ticonderoga (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-14)
* [[Bunker Hill (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-17)
* [[Bon Homme Richard (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-31) (currently story only)
* [[Shangri-La (Azur Lane)|]] (CV-38)

h4. See also

* [[USS Essex (CV-9)]]

title: velociraptor
body:
A small [[raptor]] that lived around 75-71 million years ago in Central Asia.

For tagging purposes this tag more accurately refers to dinosaurs from the [i]Dromaeosauridae[/i] (aka "Raptor") family of small to medium-sized dinosaurs, which contained [i]Velociraptor[/i] and related species. Members of this family varied in size from turkey size to full grown adult human height. Mass media has popularized lizard-like featherless depictions of these dinosaurs, though evidence suggests they were fully covered with down-like [[feathers]]. 

h4. See also 

* Wikipedia: "Dromaeosauridae":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dromaeosauridae 
* Wikipedia: "Velociraptor":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velociraptor

title: meltryllis_(swimsuit_lancer)_(third_ascension)_(fate)
body:
[[meltryllis (swimsuit lancer) (fate)|Meltryllis Swimsuit Lancer]] in her Third Ascension swimsuit from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She has her hair done up in a high side ponytail tied with a blue bow. She wears a blue choker, a white frilled bikini, long white sleeves that reach past her hands, a long blue skirt attached to the bikini bottom, and white pantyhose. Her leg stilettos reach to her knees and are angled to resemble ice skates.

h4. Appearance
* !post #9205928

She wears a blue choker, a blue highleg one-piece swimsuit with a white frilled trim around the shoulders, and white sleeves that reach past her hands. title: aesc_(fate)
body:
Old English for "[b]ash tree[/b]", alternatively known as [b]Tonelico[/b] in the original Japanese.

The savior in the legend of Faerie Britain in Lostbelt no. 6, Avalon le Fae. [spoilers]She is the Lostbelt's [[Morgan le Fay (Fate)|]] before she gave up her ideal of saving the Faeries after countless betrayals and turns into the tyrannical Lostbelt Queen when Chaldea arrives.[/spoilers]

Her appearance is almost identical to that of [[Artoria Caster (second ascension) (fate)|Artoria Caster's second Ascension]], [spoilers]as they both originated as Faeries of Avalon[/spoilers]. The most prominent differences are the color of the bow holding up her [[capelet]] being [[black bow|black]] instead of [[blue bow|blue]]/[[purple bow|purple]] and the staff she holds not being the [[Staff of Selection (fate)|]]. Other differences include the design & color of the [[brooch]] on the bow, the size of the bow on the back of her hat, and the design on the side of her hat, though not all of these may be incorporated in illustrations. [spoiler]Her summonable form's [[aesc (savior) (fate)|second Ascension]] also resembles [[Artoria Caster (third Ascension) (Fate)|Artoria Caster's third Ascension]] for similar reasons.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Ishikawa Yui]]

title: duryodhana_(fate)
body:
A Berserker-class servant first appearing in the [[Paper Moon (fate/grand order)|]] chapter of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. One of the major characters of the Mahabharata as the eldest of the Hundred Princes that opposed the Five Princes. Ultimately died in a duel against [[Bhima (fate)|]], trusting [[Ashwatthama (fate)|]] to carry on his will.

title: serenitea_pot_(genshin_impact)
body:
The Serenitea Pot or Realm Within is a system in [[Genshin Impact]] that allows a player to decorate a home and the realm surrounding it. Players interact with this system using a gadget of the same name that is given to them by [[Madame Ping (Genshin Impact)|Madame Ping]].

[[Tubby (Genshin Impact)|Tubby]] and [[Chubby (Genshin Impact)|Chubby]] are two Teapot Spirits who appear in this realm. Players can also add any of the characters they've personally obtained (aside from the Player Character) to their teapots as "Companions" which allows them to idly increase their Friendship Level with those characters.

title: 1hp_club
body:
A webcomic based around a group of friends playing D&D, and the misadventures of their own characters, 1HP Club is a "comic about the daily life of dungeon boys. Slaying the city, saving the dragons... or something like that" (Webtoon). 

The main cast features:
* [[Alice_(1HP_Club)]], a human played by Izzy. 
* [[Imsh]], a half-orc played by Tim.
* [[Obi (1HP Club)]], an elf played by the artist Theo.
* [[Solaire_(1HP_Club)]], a half-elf played by Jesus.
* [[No-one_(1HP_Club)]], a tiefling played by Jade. 
* [[Ffion_(1HP_Club)]]
* [[God_(1HP_Club)]], or the dungeon master, played by Gareth.

The side cast features:
* [[Niffin (1Hp Club)]] 
* [[Nagi (1Hp Club)]] 
* [[Chester (1Hp Club)]]

title: highmore_(arknights)
body:
[i]Branch Operator Highmore, more belligerent than her looks suggest.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Iberia[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]August 23[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Aegir[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]156 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

One of the main characters in the Integrated Strategies event [i]"Mizuki & Caerula Arbor".[/i]

[spoiler]Because of her Aegirian race, her family was persecuted by the Inquisition and the townsfolk of their village. She was rescued by a bishop of the Church of the Deep, who promised her an idealistic world if she let him transform her into a Seaborn. Realizing that she wouldn't be able to sing anymore, she rejects her new form mid-transformation and is rescued by [[Mizuki (arknights)|]], who brings her to Rhodes Island.[/spoiler]

Her motif is based on Violescent sea-whip corals.

Her [[voice actor]]s are Ooshita Natsumi (Japanese), Xu Xiaowen (Chinese), Ashlyn Madden (English), and Lee Da-eun (Korean). Her art designer is [[hoirn|Horin_]].

h4. Skins
* !post #9418884: [[highmore_(stranded)_(arknights)|Stranded]]
* [[Highmore (The Land With Me) (Arknights)|The Land With Me]]
other_names: ハイモア(アークナイツ)

title: outis_(project_moon)
body:
[[Limbus Company]] character.

Sinner No.12. Based on the main character "Odysseus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odysseus from the ancient Greek epic poem "The Odyssey":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Odyssey written by the poet "Homer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homer.

She has [[dark skin]], [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], wears [[multiple earrings]] and a broken [[wristwatch]] which she retains across all of her identities. She wears the uniform of all [[Limbus Company]] sinners, consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[red necktie]], [[black vest]], [[black pants]], but replaces the [[black coat]] with a [[black jacket]]. 

She wields a [[falcata]] in her base identity, with the Greek word 'Ουτις' ('Nobody' In English) etched into the blade.

h4. Official art

* !post #5025978: [[Official art]]

title: momone_momo
body:
An [[UTAU]]loid, whose design is by [[momomomo]] and voicebank by Momoko Fujimoto. Although her voicebank is human, it has been described as being robotic and airy, but not as much as [[Utane Uta]]'s.

She has dark pink hair and green eyes. She wears a green beret and a stylized [[maid]] outfit with a white apron.

(excerpts from "Utau.wiki":http://utau.wikia.com/wiki/UTAUloids#Momo_Momone_.28.E6.A1.83.E9.9F.B3.E3.83.A2.E3.83.A2.29)

title: buggy_the_clown
body:
[[One Piece]] character. Captain of a circus-themed pirate ship and [[monkey d. luffy|Luffy's]] rival. Formerly one of the [[Shichibukai]], and later on the [spoiler]figurehead[/spoiler] leader of the Cross Guild [spoiler]and one of the Four Emperors.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Buggy originally served as an apprentice for [[Gol D. Roger]]'s pirate crew alongside [[Shanks (one piece)|]].[/spoiler]

Having consumed the Bara Bara no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he can split his body into pieces and control said pieces at will.


He is voiced by [[Chiba Shigeru]].

title: f1_(movie)
body:
A [[2025]] sports-action film about a fictional [[Formula One|Formula 1]] team [i]APXGP[/i], starring [[Brad Pitt]] and directed by Joseph Kosinski. 

It was produced in collaboration with the [[Federation Internationale De L'automobile|FIA]], the governing body of Formula 1, with racing scenes shot during actual races throughout [[2023]] and [[2024]].

title: sugitani_zenjubou_(fate)
body:
Archer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. They first appeared as a nameless Sharpshooter from the Revenge Realm in the [[Traum (fate/grand order)|]] chapter before being introduced as the playable servant "Sugitani Zenjubou":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sugitani_Zenjūbō in the [[Shiroten no Shiro Kuroban no Shiro|Shiroten no Shiro, Kuroban no Shiro]] event.

In life, Zenjubou was a sniper who attempted to assassinate [[Oda Nobunaga (fate)|]]. While on the run as a fugitive after his failure, he met the sorcerer [[Kashin Koji (fate)|]], who disguised his appearance by turning him into a woman. They still use the masculine pronoun [b]Ore[/b] as a servant.

Unlike most of Fate characters from the Sengoku period, they're from proper human history as opposed to the alternate history of the [[Koha-Ace]] timeline, and as such isn't familiar with the female Nobunaga.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takenaka Hideo]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Gotou Yuuko]]

title: formula_one
body:
[b]Formula One[/b], also known as [b]Formula 1[/b] or [b]F1[/b] and referred to officially as the [b]FIA Formula One World Championship[/b], is the highest class of [[formula racer|single-seater auto racing]] sanctioned by the [[federation internationale de l'automobile|Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile]] (FIA). The word "formula" in the name refers to the set of rules with which all participants' cars must comply. A Formula One season consists of a series of races, known as Grands Prix (from French, originally meaning great prizes), held throughout the world on purpose-built circuits and public roads.

h4. See also
* [[F1 (movie)]]
* [[Formula Racer]]
* [[Racecar]]
* [[Racing Suit]]

h4. External links

* "Official Website":http://www.formula1.com/
* "Wikipedia: Formula One":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formula_One

title: fuwawa_abyssgard
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and one of the Twin Demonic Guard Dogs of hololive English [[holoadvent|Advent]], the third generation of [[hololive English]], along with her younger twin sister [[Mococo Abyssgard]]. Designed by [[Icomochi]].

She's a [[dog girl]] with both [[dog ears]] and a [[dog tail|tail]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[pink eyes]] and [[medium breasts|medium]]-to-[[large breasts]]. Her default hairstyle is a [[two side up]] and [[crossed bangs|crossed]] [[double-parted bangs]] [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]], decorated with a [[blue hairband|blue]] [[horn hairband]] a [[bandaid hair ornament]] and a pair of [[parallel hairclips]].

She can be distinguished from Mococo by her longer hair with blue streaks and her larger breasts.

Usually drawn with [[feathered wings]], a [[black dress]] with [[bare shoulders]], a [[choker]], [[argyle thighhighs]] with [[high heels]] and [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], in addition to Akemi Homura's usual [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. Her hair is usually tied up with a [[hair bow|bow]].

Her familiars are the [[Clara Dolls (madoka magica)|]].

Also known as "Homucifer" in reference to [i]Paradise Lost[/i].

title: the_karate_kid
body:
Martial arts media franchise spanning four films, an animated series, a part sequel movie ([i]The Next Karate Kid[/i]), a streaming series continuing from the first three movies ([i]Cobra Kai[/i]), and a "remake" set in China.

The first three films concern Daniel LaRusso (Ralph Macchio), who learns [[karate]] from an unlikely sensei, his apartment complex's handman Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) after being bullied by the Cobra Kai gang whose leader is an ex-boyfriend of Daniel's love interest Ali Mills.

Known in Japan as [i]Best Kid[/i].

h4. Further reading
* "Wikipedia: [i]The Karate Kid[/i] (franchise)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Karate_Kid_(franchise)]

title: moe_(phrase)
body:
[b]Moe[/b] (萌え, pronounced "mo-eh", literally "budding", as with a plant) is a Japanese slang word originally referring to fetish or love for characters in video games or anime and manga. For example, meganekko-moe (眼鏡っ娘萌え), or "glasses-girl moe" describes a person who is attracted to characters with [[glasses]]. In modern Western usage, it typically is used to describe a character who is considered cute or adorable.

This tag should only be used for images that reference the concept of moe, not when the image evokes a feeling of moe itself.

h4. Examples

* !post #584221

h4. See also

* [[so moe i'm gonna die!]]
* [[ultimate moe]]

h4. External links

* "TVTropes: Moe":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Moe
* "Wikipedia: Moe":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moe_(slang)

title: manga_time_kirara
body:
A Japanese manga magazine published by Houbunsha, and is the first one focusing on [[moe (phrase)|]] [[4koma]] comic strips. Common themes include (but not limited to) slice-of-life and light-hearted [[yuri]]. The magazine, itself a spin-off of the Manga Time magazine, has spawned some number of sister magazines that are similarly named, including Manga Time Kirara Carat, MAX, Forward, Miracle, and Magica. 

Several of the series have been successful enough to receive anime adaptations. The openings of the anime adaptions are known for featuring the [[Kirara Jump]].

The magazine also has a cross-over game, [[Kirara Fantasia]], that brings together characters from different series in a fantasy setting.

title: koufuku_graffiti
body:
A [[4koma]] series written and illustrated by [[Kawai Makoto]] and serialized in [[Manga Time Kirara]] magazine from 2012 to 2016. A 12-episode anime adaptation by Shaft aired in 2015. 

The story follows a middle-school student named [[Machiko Ryou]], who lives on her own. She has a passion for cooking and makes friendships through her cooking. 

With slightly erotic food scenes, both the anime and manga are full of detailed cuisine art to whet the appetite. The "koufuku" in the title is a wordplay on two Japanese homonyms—one which means "happiness," and another that means "appetite."

Author and Artist: [[Kawai Makoto]]

h4.See also

* [[Shiawase graffiti]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Gourmet Girl Graffiti":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gourmet_Girl_Graffiti]

title: fly_agaric
body:
A large red-capped [[mushroom]] with white spots, also known by its scientific name [i]Amanita muscaria[/i]. Its distinctive features have made it the iconic toadstool in popular culture, notably as the inspiration for [[power-up|]]s in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. It is a known hallucinogen but can be made edible by boiling.

* [[Super mushroom]] 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Amanita muscaria":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amanita_muscaria

title: super_mushroom
body:
The most iconic [[power-up]] from [[Nintendo]]'s [[Mario (series)|]] series of games. It makes the user grow twice as large, stronger, and more resistant to damage. Its most common depiction has a red cap with white spots (resembling an immature [[fly agaric|Amanita muscaria]]) and a beige stipe with black eyes.

In the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series, it serves as the icon for characters and stages from the Mario series.

title: black_sun_(symbol)
body:
A symbol derived from the ancient German mark of the [i]Sonnenrad[/i] or "[[Sun symbol|Sun]] wheel". It was used by the [[Waffen-SS]] in their [[building]]s and installations during [[World War II]].

The symbol's design consists of a [[circle]] with twelve radial [[siegrunen|sig runes]]. It first appeared in [[Nazi]] Germany as a design element in a castle at Wewelsburg remodeled and expanded by the head of the SS, [[Heinrich Luitpold Himmler|Heinrich Himmler]], which he intended to be a center for the SS.

h4. See also

* [[swastika]]
* [[Totenkopf]]
* [[Wolfsangel]]
* [[Tag Group:Symbols]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Black Sun (symbol)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Sun_(symbol)]

title: darksign_(dark_souls)
body: A visual motif from Fromsoft's [[Dark Souls (Series)|]] series, representing the fiery containment of the titular "dark soul". Takes the form of a solid black circle and a ring of vertically moving or radial flames, resembling a solar eclipse.

title: minigun
body:
A [[gatling gun]] used as a personal portable weapon.

For the specific personnel gatling gun model, see [[M134 Minigun]].

title: delinquent
body:
A stereotypical "rebellious" and oftentimes outlaw youngster, especially teenage high school students.

Delinquents have come in many types in different times and places, but the stereotype tends to attach itself to whatever scary new subculture they have come up with at that time: greasers in 1950s America, mods and rockers in 1960s Britain, [[punk]]s everywhere since the 1970s.

body:
[b]Double-Fake Under The Gundam[/b] ([i]Daburufeiku Andā Za Gandamu[/i]) is a side-story that focuses on a decoy operation launched by [[Char Aznable]] in U.C.0090.

 It is a 1988 original [[Gundam]] manga created by [[Ushida Yuji]], originally published in [[Bandai]]'s Model Journal magazine.

title: hambrabi
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985. Also appears more recently in [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]] (2025) with its own design.

[b]RX-139 Hambrabi[/b]

A sinister looking, well armed, fast and nimble (but light armored) transformable [[mobile suit]] designed by [[Paptimus Scirocco]] and fielded by the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] that is optimized mostly for [[close-quarters combat|close combat]] and aero[[space]] assaults. It possesses powerful beam weapons and  a total of five monoeye sensors all over it, which enable for great tracking of targets.  

The type's most famous pilot was [[Yazan Gable]]. [spoiler]Yazan's unit was destroyed by an enraged [[Kamille Bidan]] in his [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]], but he survived its destruction inside an escape pod.[/spoiler]

title: right-over-left_kimono
body:
A [[kimono]] worn with its right side folded over its left. Traditionally this is how the recently deceased are dressed for burial, consequently it is a major faux pas to wear a kimono this way while alive. Fictional works may sometimes feature [[ghost]]s (or other beings connected to death) wearing them. Occasionally the product of [[artistic error]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6005649

h4. See also

* [[funeral kimono]]
* [[shiroshouzoku]]
* [[triangular headpiece]]

h4. External links

* "Hyakumonogatari Kaidankai: What is the White Kimono Japanese Ghosts Wear?": https://hyakumonogatari.com/2012/04/04/what-is-the-white-kimono-japanese-ghosts-wear/

title: ninomae_ina'nis
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoMyth|1st generation]]. Designed by [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]].

She has [[pointy ears]], a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]] a pointy [[fang]] and a [[flat chest]] (much to her dismay), as well as two "ear"-like protrusions sticking out of her hair (a reference to similar flaps in some cephalopods), and pair of [[white wings|white]] [[low wings|low]] [[feathered wings]] wrapped around her waist. When in her "full" form she gets a [[halo]] above her head and several large [[tentacles]] on her back.

She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]], [[straight hair|straight]] [[purple hair|dark purple]]/[[black hair]] with two short [[sidelocks]] that turn into [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[orange hair|orange]] [[tentacle hair|tentacles]] and [[blunt bangs]] in a [[center-flap bangs|center flap]].

title: hakos_baelz
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] from [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]], designed by [[Mika Pikazo]].

The leader of holoCouncil, she's the embodiment of chaos who manifests as a [[mouse girl|rat girl]] to signify her power.

She has [[mouse ears]] and a [[mouse tail|tail]] with a [[tail bow]]. Her hair is mostly [[red hair|red]] with [[streaked hair|streaks]] of [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair|white]] and black [[colored tips]], she also has [[blue eyes]] with red highlights and [[medium breasts]] (although artists often depict them in [[alternate breast size (smaller)|varying]] [[alternate breast size (larger)|sizes]]).

Her default hairstyle is [[uneven twintails]] tied with [[dice hair ornament]]s and [[double-parted bangs]] reaching [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]].

title: irys_(hololive)
body:
A [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] of [[hololive English]]. A Nephilim who, upon her second awakening, has descended upon the current era to bring hope through song. Designed by [[Redjuice]].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair|dark purple]] and [[red hair]]. True to her lore, she is portrayed with a [[halo]] made out of 2 layers of black and white stars, [[heterochromia|heterochromic]] [[pink eyes|purple]] and [[blue eyes]], black [[horns]], [[pointy ears]], and [[asymmetrical wings|differently-colored]] [[crystal wings]].

Formerly operated under the solo "Project:HOPE" from July 2021 until October 2023, when she was "reassigned":[https://twitter.com/hololive_En/status/1711232551061516715] to a new group with the four remaining [[holoCouncil]] members as "hololive English -Promise-". 

Similar to [[hololive]] Japan's [[AZKi (hololive)|]], her name is stylized [i]IRyS[/i], with only one letter in lower case.

title: ouro_kronii
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] who is part of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoCouncil|2nd]] [[holoPromise|generation]]. Designed by [[Wada Arco]].

Refers to herself as "Kronii Ouro". Lore-wise, she is the warden of time who can control the flow of time itself.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair|dark blue]] or [[black hair]] with blue [[colored inner hair]], [[blue eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She also has a large clock-shaped  [[mechanical halo]], which she can use to rewind time. Her default hairstyle consists of large [[hair intakes]] that turn into [[hair flaps]] held by a [[chain headband|chain]] [[headband]] decorated with a small [[white veil]].

title: amate_yuzuriha
body:
Female protagonist of [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]], better known by her nickname, "Machu":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machu_Picchu]. She is also the second female protagonist of a [[Gundam]] TV anime, succeeding [[Suletta Mercury]] from [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]]. Machu's [[mobile suit]] of choice is the [[GQuuuuuux]].

Her voice actress is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

Amate's character design is similar to [[Elpeo Puru]] and [[Puru Two]] from [[Gundam ZZ]].

title: audio_jack
body:
A connector commonly used for audio equipment. Sometimes called a headphone jack, jack plug, phone jack, or phone connector.

Almost all [[headphones]], [[microphone]]s and most consumer [[speaker]]s have one of these connectors. Consumer equipment usually has the small 3.5 mm plug and professional equipment has the large 6.35 mm plug. Electric guitars and effects units always use the 6.35 mm plug.

Plugs have a single prong with separately connected tip, sleeve, and usually one ring, sometimes more. Mono audio has no ring, often found on microphones; stereo audio has one ring and headsets with integrated microphones or control buttons have two or more rings.

h4. Examples

* !post #3788806: 6.35 mm variant with tip, ring and sleeve for stereo audio
* !post #2684511: 3.5 mm variant with tip, ring and sleeve
* !post #2331144: 3.5 mm variant with tip, two rings and sleeve

h4. See also

* [[RCA connector]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Phone connector":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phone_connector_(audio)]

title: morton_koopa_jr.
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], he is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. Morton appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

Like his siblings, Morton uses his [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on his head three times. He uses ground pounds to stun the player and uses his magic [[wand]] to summon spells or [[spiked ball]]s. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], he no longer has a wand and now uses a giant [[hammer]] filled with magic. He is also the physically strongest of the Koopalings, though he isn't as powerful as some of his other brothers, like [[Ludwig von Koopa]] or [[Roy Koopa]].

Morton is depicted as rather simple-minded, being proudly more brawn than brains and is prone to temper tantrums. He likes to boast about his strength and often refers to himself in third-person. Like most of the Koopalings, he wears [[spiked bracelet]]s on each arm and is the only Koopaling to not have a [[yellow skin]] complexion, being [[grey skin|grey]] instead. He is also the largest of his siblings and has only three strands of hair, a grey [[spiked shell]], a [[big mouth]] with large [[fangs]] and a [[star (symbol)|]]-shaped birthmark over his left eye.

He is named after Morton Downey Jr., a famed talk show host, actor and singer.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31156804: Regular
* !asset #31172556: Dr. Morton

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]] 
* [[Princess Morton Koopa Jr.]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Morton":https://www.mariowiki.com/Morton

title: ludwig_von_koopa
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], he is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. Ludwig appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]]. He served as [[Bowser]]'s second-in-command before [[Bowser Jr.]] and [[Kamek]] came along.

Like his siblings, Ludwig uses his [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on his head three times. He uses his magic [[wand]] to summon multiple blue [[fireball]]s at once, some of which can home in on the player and can also levitate. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], he can now create fake duplicates of himself. He is also the most talented and most powerful of the Koopalings.

Ludwig is depicted as intelligent, precocious and cynical and is the oldest of his siblings. He considers himself the leader of the Koopalings, though the others deny it. He loves playing [[video game]]s with his younger brothers and likes listening to classical music, even being a composer himself. Like most of the Koopalings, he wears [[spiked bracelet]]s on each arm and has a mostly [[yellow skin]] complexion, as well as a green head. He is average height and has [[blue hair|blue]] [[parted hair]], a blue [[spiked shell]] and an overbite with a [[single tooth]].

He is named after [[Ludwig van Beethoven]], a famous German composer and pianist.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7952731: Regular
* !asset #31160570: Dr. Ludwig

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]] 
* [[Princess Ludwig Von Koopa]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Ludwig":https://www.mariowiki.com/Ludwig

title: graham_aker
body:
Graham Aker is a pilot and antagonist of [[Gundam 00]] and rival of [[Setsuna F. Seiei]]. 

He is an American Flag Fighter of the Union, and is well-known for his high-speed, high-risk piloting style. Like Setsuna, Graham also specializes in close-quarters combat. He is also known for being a [[left-handed]] person, which is also carried onto his piloting (thus, all of the MS tailored to him are also left-handed).

He pilots the [[Flag Custom]], the [[Union Flag]], and later a custom Ahead (known as the Ahead Sakigake), the [[Masurao]], the [[Susanoo (Gundam)|Susanowo]], the [[Brave Commander Test Type]] in A Wakening of the Trailblazer, [spoiler]and the [[Gundam Exia Repair IV]][/spoiler].

title: ecole_du_ciel
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: École du Ciel[/b] (機動戦士ガンダム エコール·デュ·シエル [i]Kidou Senshi Gandamu Ekooru dyu Shieru[/i]) (lit. [b]School Of The Sky[/b]) is a [[Gundam]] manga series written and illustrated by [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]]. It began serialization in 2001 Kadokawa Shoten's [[Gundam Ace]] but has been on hiatus since 2011. Up to 9 volumes were released in English by [[Tokyopop]]. 

In the manga [i]École du Ciel[/i] is the name of an [[Earth Federation]] military school for training future [[mobile suit]] pilots in Montréal, [[Canada]]. Unexpected events occur, exposing cadet Asuna Elmarit and her classmates to the reality that is war.

Ecole du Ciel is a spinoff story set in the Universal Century timeline, taking place before and during the events of [[Zeta Gundam]]. It is one of the few and earliest Gundam entries to feature a female protagonist.

title: wetland
body:
An ecosystem that is flooded by [[water]] and features plants and animals adept to surviving waterlogged environments.

There are four major types of wetlands: swamp, marsh, bog, and fen.  Swamps are dominated by trees, marshes by reeds, and bogs & fens by mosses.  Bogs and fens are collectively called "peatlands" and feature a large amount of peat (partially decomposed plant matter) in their soils and due to this have poor soils that prevent larger plants from growing.

h4. See also
* [[Lily pad]] 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wetland]

title: shrug_(clothing)
body:
A type of garment consisting of only sleeves. They are usually worn on top of another shirt, but they are often drawn as a sort of [[lingerie]] or plain shirt in art depicting them.

Different from [[detached sleeves]] in that the sleeves are connected to eachother. They go past the shoulder and are typically connected in the back, but they can also be connected through a [[turtleneck]].

Use [[collared shrug]] as well if applicable.

title: glaive_(polearm)
body:
A glaive is a European [[polearm]] weapon, consisting of a single-edged blade on the end of a pole. It is similar to the Japanese [[naginata]] and the Chinese [[guan dao]].

The term "glaive" has also been repurposed in certain (primarily Western) fantasy series to describe an oversized throwing weapon resembling a [[shuriken]], [[chakram]] or [[throwing knife]]. [b]Do not[/b] tag these examples as glaive; use the appropriate tags instead.

h4. Notable characters
* [[Tatsuta_(kancolle)|]] ([[Kantai Collection]])
* [[Hellion (darkest_dungeon)|]] ([[Darkest Dungeon]]) 
* [[Sailor Saturn]] ([[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]])
** Her Silence Glaive is technically a glaive[i]-fork[/i], but we currently don't distinguish. [tn]And we probably shouldn't.[/tn]


h4. Tag usage notes
* Tag glaive when you see the polearm weapon described above.
* Avoid tagging glaive when the weapon can be more appropriately described with another polearm tag.
** e.g. [[naginata]], [[nagimaki]], [[guan dao]], [[scythe]], [[halberd]], [[bardiche]], [[billhook]]
* [b]Do not[/b] tag throwing weapons with glaive.
** Even if they are called "glaive" in the series. Use the appropriate throwing weapon tag instead.
** Unless some crazy person decides to use actual polearm glaives as 'throwing weapons'.


h4. See also

* [[Naginata]]
* [[Nagimaki]]
* [[Guan dao]]
* [[Scythe]]
* [[Halberd]]
* [[Bardiche]]
* [[Billhook]]
* [[Double blade]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Glaive":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glaive]

title: death_devil_(chainsaw_man)
body:
Character from [[Chainsaw Man]]. This tag is currently used for any depictions of the Death Devil. This could include any current official depictions as well as any prior depictions of the Death Devil before any official reveal. Please see the spoilers below for reference.

This tag should be used, along with [[spoilers]] if necessary, any reference to a character being the Death Devil. This could include any mentions within the artwork [url=/posts/8986371]itself[/url], [[commentary]], and in the [url=/posts/9172046]title[/url]. More examples may include imagery such as [url=/posts/8981363]skulls[/url], [spoilers] [[Fami (Chainsaw Man)|"Fami's"]] stomach [url=/posts/9711856]wound[/url][/spoilers] and more.

[spoilers]In chapter 198, the Death Devil is revealed to be [[Fami (Chainsaw Man)|"Fami"]], who was up to that point using the name and identity of the [[famine devil (chainsaw man)|Famine Devil]]. Prior to the reveal, it was assumed [[famine devil (chainsaw man)|Famine Devil]] was the Death Devil. As so, some artwork of her depicts her as the Death Devil.[/spoilers]

title: skeleton
body:
The complete set of [[bone]]s or other rigid supporting structures of a human or animal. Often seen via [[x-ray]], or left behind after flesh rots from a [[corpse]].

Skeletons animated by magic or supernatural forces should also be tagged [[undead]].

For creatures with external skeletons, see the [[carapace]] tag.

If the skeleton is from an animal or non-humanoid creature in general use [[animal skeleton]].

title: organs
body:
Internal viscera that are exposed for the viewer to see. 

Please do not add the [[guro]] tag unless the character’s organs are not in their normal state (ex: outside of the body) and the image is focused on the pain the character is experiencing (associated with the organs) or the presence of organs is “fetishized” somehow. In other words, [[anatomy|anatomical]] images, characters with organs exposed as part of their natural design (ex: [[noumu (boku no hero academia)|noumu]] and brains), and the presence of disembodied organs without people being aroused/in pain should normally NOT be tagged as guro.

Not to be confused with the [[organ (instrument)|musical instrument]].

h5.Tagged organs

* [[brain]]

title: eyeball
body:
Eyes are [[organs]] that detect light, and give visual stimulation.

Tag can be used when eyeballs have a strong or obvious presence in the picture, such as floating, being held, scattered around, on characters' attire, in foreheads, etc.

Examples:

* [[Backbeard]] the giant floating eyeball from [[Gegege no Kitarou]]
* [[Nightmare (Soulcalibur)]] with his Soul Edge sword, which has a large eye near it's hilt.

title: genjitsu_no_yohane
body:
In English, [i]Yohane the Parhelion[/i]. Also subtitled [i]Sunshine in the Mirror[/i], it is a [[Love Live! Sunshine!!]] fantasy spin-off with an anime that debuted in 2023.

The first mention of an anime was as an April Fool's 2022 joke on the official [i]Love Live![/i] YouTube channel (the original has since been deleted from the official channel, but not before being "translated":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XSflX-60EAI]). On June 26, 2022, a "separate dedicated twitter account":[https://twitter.com/GJ_yohane/status/1541041754958630913] as well as a live announcement at an Aqours live confirmed that the spin-off was in the works.

The series casts Aqours in a completely new setting, set in a fantasy world version in the land of "Numazu", named after the Shizuoka Prefecture city and its surroundings (including Uchiura) that [i]Sunshine!![/i] is set in, and stars [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] as [[Yohane (genjitsu no yohane)|]] (Yoshiko's preferred fallen angel name). It tells "the story that no one knows about a girl that everyone knows," where she journeys and meets fantasy versions of other characters.

In June 2023, "[i]Blaze in the Deepblue[/i]":[http://yohane-bid.com/en/], a 2D action platform video game for the series in the vein of [[Metroid]] and [[Castlevania (series)|]], was announced after it itself was an April Fool's joke in 2023. Developed by Inti Creates, it is the first [i]Love Live![/i] console game released November 16, 2023 for [[Nintendo Switch]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[PlayStation 5|5]], [[Xbox One]] and [[Xbox Series X|Series X/S]] and [[Steam (platform)|]].

title: kitt_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] and one of the characters from the Branded card storyline.

A ferret girl, she is a younger sister of [[tri-brigade_ferrijit_the_barren_blossom|Ferrijit]] from the Tri-Brigade mercenary. She loves tinkering with gadgets, to the point where she's responsible for creating Tri-Brigade Bearbrumm the Rampant Rampager, [[Tri-Brigade Mercourier]], [[Tri-Brigade Arms Mouser]] armaments for her sister [[Tri-Brigade Ferrijit The Barren Blossom|Ferrijit]] and the [[Tri-Brigade Arms Bucephalus II]] armaments for [[tri-brigade_shuraig_the_ominous_omen|Shuraig.]]

As she saves [[Albaz (yu-gi-oh!)|]] (and to an extent [[Ecclesia (yu-gi-oh!)|]] and allies) on multiple occasions in the storyline, even having part of the story delicated to her journey to the Discolosseum, she is often jokingly referred as the "true" protagonist of the Abyss storyline. She is also depicted as either another love interest with Albaz or as Ecclecsia's wingwoman.

h4. Variants
* [[Tri-Brigade Kitt]] - Original variant while living with the Tri-Brigade.
* [[Springans Kitt]] - Kitt after leaving the Tri-Brigade to begin her journey with the Springans clan.
* [[Lindwurm the Gunhammer Dragon]] - a mechanical dragon piloted by Kitt and Albaz during the final battle against the Bystials and Despians.

title: iggy_koopa
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], he is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. Iggy appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

Like his siblings, Iggy uses his [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on his head three times. He uses his magic [[wand]] to summon spells and he also has a pet [[Chain Chomp]] that appears in some of his boss fights. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], he can now walk on ceilings and and can summon [[Magmaargh]]s. He is also the fastest of the Koopalings.

Iggy is depicted as a demented, hyperactive mechanical genius. He is always [[laughing]] and likes to provoke opponents with a joking attitude. Like most of the Koopalings, he wears [[spiked bracelet]]s on each arm and has a mostly [[yellow skin]] complexion, as well as a green head. He is rather lanky and has [[tall hair|tall]] [[green hair]], a green [[spiked shell]], large [[fangs]] and wears thick [[black-framed eyewear|black]] [[glasses]]. In his original appearance, Iggy had [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[pink hair|pink]], [[blonde hair|yellow]] and [[blue hair]].

He is named after [[Iggy Pop]], a famous American [[punk rock]] singer and leader of the band The Stooges.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31156844: Regular
* !asset #31159239: Dr. Iggy

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]]
* [[Princess Iggy Koopa]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Iggy":https://www.mariowiki.com/Iggy

title: koyanskaya_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is originally introduced as Tamamo Vitch, one of the [[Tamamo Nine]]. [[Shi Huang Di (fate)|]] also calls her "Da Ji", a Chinese figure who ruined dynasties.

[spoilers]However, Koyanskaya actually has no real True Name to speak of, and is entirely unrelated to either the Tamamo Nine or Da Ji. Koyanskaya is "the Tunguska event given form", the embodiment of the thoughts of animals persecuted by mankind, and chose to manifest in the Saint Graph of Tamamo no Mae due to their shared attribute of being a "beast that is supposed to live for revenge against humans." She likens herself to "the Tamamo no Mae from another world," considering Tamamo to be her original, but she's not actually Tamamo nor is she part of the Tamamo Nine.

She was given the name Yaskaya by the manifested Heroic Spirit [[dobrynya nikitich (fate)|Dobrynya Nikitich]], which she later mistakenly remembered as Koyanskaya. This is an allusion to the Shinto goddess [[Konohanasakuya-hime (mythology)|]], to which Koyanskaya has no relation whatsoever.

When she was defeated in her Beast form, she split into two distinct but similar fragments, Koyanskaya of Light and Koyanskaya of Darkness, in a contrast akin to yin and yang.[/spoilers]

She has been released as an Assassin class Servant in Fate/Grand Order under the name "Koyanskaya of Light", and shortly afterwards as a Foreigner class Servant under the name "Koyanskaya of Darkness".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Saitou Chiwa]]

body: Images featuring [[Kiyohime (fate)|]], [[Hassan of Serenity (fate)|]], and [[Minamoto no Raikou (fate)|]] grouped together.
