title: kogetsukan_satsujin_jiken
body:
[b]Murder at the Kogetsukan[/b]

[quote]
The story begins at the luxurious Kogetsukan Hotel.
You arrive there for what was meant to be a four-day, three-night stay.
A threatening letter delivered to the hotel turns out to be deadly serious when a guest is murdered.
As one of the characters drawn into this, you find yourself on a quest to uncover the culprit.
What truth will come to light during your seven-day investigation?
[/quote]

A murder mystery-themed event in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It was guest-written by Madoi Ban and later adapted into a novel illustrated by [[Yamanaka Kotetsu]].

In it, Fujimaru Ritsuka has a dream where they witness a murder case unfold between a meeting of two crime families. All the characters in it are portrayed by servants Ritsuka is contracted to, due to their brain filling in missing details. [[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]], [[James Moriarty (Archer) (fate)|]], and [[Mash Kyrielight]] end up helping guide Ritsuka to solving the mystery.

h4. Characters
* Aaron Goldie ([[Fionn mac Cumhaill (fate/grand order)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]The patriarch of the family and the father of Morris and Lorie, with Dorthy as his second wife. Had affairs with both Harriet and Ann, and is the true father of Juliet, Eva, and Chris.[/spoiler]
* Dorthy Goldie ([[Marie Antoinette (fate)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]Aaron's second wife, Morris' stepmother, and Lorie's mother.[/spoiler]
* Morris Goldie ([[Mordred (fate/apocrypha)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]Eldest son of Aaron and his first wife.[/spoiler]
* Lorie Goldie ([[Paul Bunyan (fate)|]])
** Member of the Goldie family. [spoiler]The daughter of Aaron and Dorthy.[/spoiler]
* Adamska Violet ([[Lancelot (fate/grand order)|]])
** Father of the Violet family, who married into the family and took on their last name. [spoiler]While Cain is his legitimate son, when he married Harriet she was pregnant with Aaron's children, though this isn't public knowledge and the two are legally recognized as his children.[/spoiler]
* Eva Violet ([[Minamoto no Raikou (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. [spoiler]Because she's represented by Raikou, Ritsuka mistakes her for being Adamska's wife, but she is actually Juliet's younger twin sister. She's the daughter of Aaron and Harriet from an affair, with Adamska as her legal father.[/spoiler]
* Juliet Violet ([[Stheno (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. Attends college with Rikka, and is the reason they were at the meeting of the Goldie and Violet families. [spoiler]Eldest daughter of Adamska and Harriet, with Eva being her younger twin sister. Correctly guessed by players as the true culprit behind the murders.[/spoiler]
* Harriet Violet ([[Euryale (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. [spoiler]Because she's represented by Euryale, Ritsuka mistakes her for being Juliet's sister, but she's actually Juliet & Eva's mother. She became pregnant with twins after an affair with Aaron, marrying Adamska and having them legally recognized as their children. Cain is her youngest child.[/spoiler]
* Cain Violet ([[Mephistopheles (fate)|]])
** Member of the Violet family. [spoiler]Raised as the brother of Juliet and Eva, but is actually their half-sibling, having a different father than the twins.[/spoiler]
* Hawthorne ([[James Moriarty (Archer) (fate)|]])
** Family doctor of the Violets.
* Ann ([[Jaguarman (fate)|]])
** Member of the Marble trading company and a long-time business partner of Aaron Goldie. [spoiler]The mother of Chris, who she had from an affair with Aaron, though she kept his parentage secret, not recognizing him as her son.[/spoiler]
* Wu ([[Yan Qing (fate)|]])
** Martial artist working for the Marble trading company. Mentioned in [[Fate/strange fake]] to have once fought [[Bazdilot Cordelion]].
* Chris ([[Bedivere (fate)|]])
** Member of the Marble trading company, with Ann as his primary caretaker. [spoiler]Is actually Ann's son, born from a one-time affair with Aaron, though he's unaware of his parentage.[/spoiler]
* [[Rikka Fujimar]] ([[Fujimaru Ritsuka]])
** A college student who was invited to the island by their friend Juliet. [spoiler]Portrayed in the novel as a [[reverse trap|cross-dressing woman]] [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[look-alike]] for the [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (Male)|male Ritsuka]], who attended as Juliet's pretend boyfriend in order to ward off advances from Morris.[/spoiler]
* Sherringham ([[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]])
** [spoiler]Believed by Ritsuka to be someone identified as having the appearance of Holmes like the others, but is actually Holmes himself taking on a false role.[/spoiler]

h4. See Also
* [[Madou Meihou-sou no Kousatsu]]

title: larry_koopa
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], he is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. Larry appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

Like his siblings, Larry uses his [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on his head three times. He uses his magic [[wand]] to summon spells, though they are rather weak. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], he can also summon water [[geyser]]s to aid him. He is generally considered the weakest of the Koopalings.

Larry is depicted as naïve and somewhat childish, though he also can have a short temper. He cares alot for his hair, always [[brushing hair|brushing]] it and also has great admiration for his brother, [[Ludwig von Koopa|Ludwig]]. He is the youngest of his siblings. Like most of the Koopalings, he wears [[spiked bracelet]]s on each arm and has a mostly [[yellow skin]] complexion, as well as a green head. He is rather short and has [[blue hair]] resembling a cockscomb, a blue [[spiked shell]] and large [[fangs]]. 

He is named after Larry Mullen Jr., the drummer for the Irish [[rock (music)|]] band [[U2 (band)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7938214: Regular 
* !asset #31159233: Dr. Larry
* !asset #31158805: Wintertime

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]] 
* [[Princess Larry Koopa]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Larry":https://www.mariowiki.com/Larry
other_names: ラリー(スーパーマリオ)

title: nahui_mictlan_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 7: Golden Sea of Trees Travelogue, Nahui Mictlan: Those Who Rule the Planet[/b]
[quote]The Foreign God has attacked the Wandering Sea. Chaldea escapes in the Storm Border, though at a great cost. Now they begin their attempt to enter the seventh Lostbelt and finally put a stop to the Foreign God's terrible machinations.

This seventh Lostbelt is situated in the Amazon rainforest of South America. A lush, fertile land brimming with trees, this place nurtured many forms of life. This place is said to be the wellspring of all life on Earth. But, with the Tree of Emptiness haven taken root, this place has become a wasteland of death, of cracked soil and parched earth, overhung with rumbling thunderheads.

Why is this once-lush land now dead? What course did this Lostbelt's history take?

In this harsh South American Lostbelt, devoid of all life, humanity readies itself to confront the only remaining threat.[/quote]

The seventh and final Lostbelt story arc in [[Fate/Grand Order]], taking place in South America and supervised by the Crypter [[Daybit Sem Void]].

Part 1 was released on the Japanese server on December 25, 2022, and on the NA server on December 25, 2024. Part 2 was released on the Japanese server on January 31, 2023, and on the NA server on January 15, 2025.

title: traum_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Realm of the Thanatos Impulse, Traum[/b]
[quote]
Having conquered the British Lostbelt and the NFF HQ, Chaldea detects a massive Singularity with an immeasurable Humanity Foundation Value. It is a world split into three realms—each with its own king—where Servants are ceaselessly summoned to battle each other.

Chaldea's Master is overwhelmed by the unthinkable sight of armies of Servants clashing ceaselessly. As if to make things worse, an unseen hand slowly but surely reaches out for Master.

"Who could have done this, and why? Most importantly, how did they summon so many Servants?"

This is not a typical mission into a Singularity. Who could this Master be? Some mysteries may be better left unsolved...
[/quote]

A singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in North America and occurring before the events of [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|]]. [spoiler]It is maintained by [[Specimen E]] in order to enact revenge on the Human Order.[/spoiler] It was released on the Japanese server on June 1, 2022, and on the NA server on May 13, 2024.

title: tunguska_sanctuary_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Anti-Primate Biosphere, Tunguska Sanctuary[/b]
[quote]
After escaping the mayhem of the Sixth Lostbelt, Koyanskaya began to quietly but determinedly rebuild her strength. An urgent communication from Sion alerts Chaldea to the threat Koyanskaya poses, and they begin working on a plan to defeat her.

The decisive battle will take place at the headwaters of the Tunguska River in Russia, the final forest sanctuary of living things on the bleached earth. There, Master must fight to put an end to the cycle of hatred...
[/quote]

title: avalon_le_fae_(fate/grand_order)
body:
The sixth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set on the isle of Great Britain and supervised by the Crypter [[Beryl Gut]]. It was released in three parts on the Japanese server on June 11, 2021, July 14, 2021, and August 4 2021, and on the NA server on June 6, 2023, June 20, 2023, and July 10, 2023. [[Habetrot (fate)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the lostbelt.

h4. Lostbelt No. 6: Fae Round Table Domain, Avalon le Fae

[quote]
The fierce battle in Olympus ended in Chaldea's victory over the Greek gods, as well as the confirmed simultaneous termination of the sixth Tree of Emptiness. Without the Tree of Emptiness, the sixth Lostbelt ceased to be a threat, leaving only the seventh Lostbelt to conquer.
...Or so it was believed.
But the Observation Lens Sheba projects a different future: the imminent collapse of the planet itself, triggered by the sixth Lostbelt.

There is hardly any time left until the planet's demise.
To prevent this untimely end, Chaldea sets foot in a mystical land inhabited by faeries—the British Lostbelt.
[/quote]

h6. Part Two

[quote]
"Chosen by the Staff of Selection, the savior, guarded by travelers from afar, shall reach the throne."

The key to the conquest of Britain is the defeat of Morgan, ruler of the Lostbelt.
The Song of Prophecy foretells her downfall once the Child of Prophecy journeys to ring the six Bells of Pilgrimage, protected by the six clans.
Also mentioned is a foreign mage—Chaldea's Master—who has been witnessed at the Child of Prophecy's side throughout Britain, giving credence to the divination.

Having earned an audience with the High Queen by warding off a Calamity, the party sets their sights on the fae capital—Camelot, the city of sin.
Prophecy and calamity, Faeries and humans.
What end awaits at the crossroads of fate once myriad expectations come into play?
[/quote]

title: olympus_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 5: Interstellar Mountainous City, Olympus[/b]
[quote]
Four Lostbelts have been cut away from Proper Human History.
As they break through the great ocean that remained unchanged since the Age of Gods, the Chaldeans see before them a Tree of Emptiness that stretches out into space, along with a giant floating city towering majestically over all, symbolizing the absolute rule of the gods.

Olympus...

A throne for the superior deities and a great Interstellar city so massive that even the vast sea of the skies is no obstacle to it.

The final battle for humanity versus the gods...and Master versus Crypter begins here, at the epicenter of the fifth Lostbelt.
[/quote]
The second part of the fifth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the city of Olympus and supervised by the Crypter [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]. The first part of the Lostbelt is covered during the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. Released on the Japanese server on April 9, 2020 and on the NA server on March 24, 2022.

title: atlantis_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 5: Ancient Ocean of the Dreadnought Gods, Atlantis[/b]
[quote]
Kirschtaria, the leader of the Crypters, controls a Lostbelt rich in giant relics left by the gods.
Its residents are strong, godsfearing people who stand firm even in the face of the Demonic Beasts which threaten the region.
It is a place dominated by a civilization that once stood at the height of supremacy, but is now little more than a shadow of its former glory.
All that remains finds itself adrift in a vast ocean.
That ocean's name: Atlantis. This world, in Proper Human History, is said to be one of the lost ancient civilizations.

A grueling conflict where both sides leave nothing in reserve ensues in the fifth and largest Lostbelt yet. It is said that this day will see a god brought down...
But will that foretelling bear fruit or wither on the vine?
[/quote]
The first part of the fifth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the Atlantic Ocean and supervised by the Crypter [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]. The second part of the Lostbelt is covered during the [[Olympus (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. Released on the Japanese server on December 18, 2019 and on the NA server on December 1, 2021.

title: imaginary_scramble
body:
[b]Concave Illogical Number: Imaginary Trench[br]Great Void Sea Battle, Imaginary Scramble - To the Surface, Nautilus![/b]
[quote]
This is a story a bit before the fifth Lostbelt...

During a Void Space submersion training session in anticipation of the upcoming battle against Kirschtaria, the Nautilus suddenly runs aground on a mysterious object in uncharted waters. During their attempt to escape from Void Space, the crew encounters a castaway who has been adrift on the sea of Imaginary Numbers.

"I'm waiting for you...in the uncharted sea and rainbow dream."

This is the Reverse Side of the World, a realm that has never been observed. Simultaneously the shallowest and deepest pitfall...the closest, furthest underworld in this world.

Who could be calling from the bottomless sea of Imaginary Numbers?
[/quote]
An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] taking place after the events of [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]]. It was released on the Japanese server on November 11, 2020 and on the NA server on October 27, 2022.

title: yugakshetra_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 4: Saṃsāra of Genesis and Terminus, Yugakshetra[/b]
[quote]
In this journey to cut down the Fantasy Trees, the battles in the Lostbelts grow more intense. To prepare for the inevitable confrontation with Kirschtaria, Chaldea journeys to the fourth Lostbelt in search of supplies and reinforcements.

The Indian Lostbelt.
Not a hint of devastation is seen in this land, where the people pray to their god each day and live humble lives. Where the Chinese Lostbelt was governed by the laws of men, this Lostbelt is a pure land ruled by the laws of its god.

What awaits the Master of Chaldea in this world trapped in perpetual Saṃsāra meant to purge all Evils?
[/quote]
The fourth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[India]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Scandinavia Peperoncino]]. Released on the Japanese server on June 15, 2019 and on the NA server on June 3, 2021.

title: ooku_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Tokugawa Restoration Labyrinth: Ooku[/b]
[quote]Headquarters has fallen eerily silent, now almost empty following an attack from the outside. Master is called urgently to the Control Room, and along with the single Servant who managed to escape harm, Rayshifts to determine the cause.

They arrive in mid-seventeenth century Japan—the Edo period.
In the deepest reaches of Edo Castle, the epicenter of the issue, the silent abnormality still grows. The castle's Ooku, a realm detached from the rest of the world, has transformed into a bottomless labyrinth brimming with sinister mystery.
The party roams the endless paths of the luxurious osuzurouka, the "corridor of bells," in search of an exit.[/quote]

An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on March 27, 2019 and on the NA server on March 23, 2021.

A singularity that formed on the bleached earth set in 17th century Japan during the [[Edo Jidai]]. It takes place before [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]] as a result of [[Arjuna Alter (fate)|]] absorbing the rest of the Indian pantheon and was created by [[Kama (Beast III/L) (fate)|Beast III/L]].

title: s_i_n_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 3: The Synchronized Intellect Nation, S I N[/b]
[quote]
Shortly after Chaldea settles in at their new base, an assassin strikes, attempting to poison members of their group.
In a desperate bid to save the lives of the assassin's would-be victims, Chaldea makes its way to the third Lostbelt, hoping to find an antidote.

They arrive in a land of eternal peace, brought on by the end of all conflict between nations.
This land knows no struggle, no tragedy, no fragility... a truly idyllic world. Time passes gently, and the people live comfortable lives. And yet...
[/quote]
The third Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[China]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Akuta Hinako]]. In this universe, the first emperor of China [[Shi Huang Di (fate)|]] managed to obtain immortality, allowing for his eternal rule.

Released on the Japanese server on November 27, 2018 and on the NA server on November 26, 2020.

title: gotterdammerung_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 2: The Eternal Icy Fire Century, Götterdämmerung[/b]
[quote]
The Baldanders of the Wandering Sea: one of the three major organizations of the magecraft world, considered to be the primordial, yet final "wall".
There, no progress or changes in magecraft arising from the evolution of civilization are acknowledged. Only Mystics from the Age of Gods are permitted in this group of mages, making it incompatible with modern human society.
The Shadow Border receives a transmission from an unknown sender containing directions to this new territory. Placing their trust in this uncertain, unconfirmed information, the protagonist and company head towards the island of the Age of Gods, hidden away in the North Sea...
[/quote]
The second Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Ophelia Phamrsolone]]. Set after 1000 BC in Scandinavia, Ragnarok was interrupted due to [[Surtr (fate)|]] devouring Fenrir, causing him to gain Fenrir's authority and bringing an immature Twilight to the world. After he was defeated, with Ragnarok being unfinished the world is now forcibly ravaged by fire and ice for 3 millennia.

Released on the Japanese server on July 18, 2018 and on the NA server on June 23, 2020.

title: anastasia_(lostbelt)_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 1: Permafrost Empire, Anastasia[/b]
[quote]
On that fateful day, the future was wiped clean. Invaders from another world have swept aside human history, bringing everything back to the beginning.
Our achievements were undone, and Proper Human History was no longer even a part of the past.
The observatory is frozen, and the world itself split into seven Lostbelts.
And now...
After three months of silence, the last remaining humans surface from the Sea of Void. They journey through a frigid, icy world, shut out from history.
April, 2018... The battle to reclaim the world and its history begins.
[/quote]
The first Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Kadoc Zemlupus]]. Here, an [[asteroid]] hit the planet in 1570 and caused an ice age, resulting in most of humanity to go extinct; however [[Ivan the Terrible (fate)|]] was able to save his country by transforming the remaining humans (including himself) into Yaga by merging them with magical beasts.

Released on the Japanese server on April 4, 2018 and on the NA server on March 27, 2020.

title: salem_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Pseudo-Singularity IV: The Forbidden Advent Garden, Salem[/b]
[quote]
It happened suddenly...without warning.

It snuffed out all the light in the land, and it enveloped an entire town under the cover of night. Such a phenomenon could only be described as...darkness. The enormous, malicious magical energy emanating from within the darkness bears a strong resemblance to the shadow of one of the Demon Gods who attempted the Incineration of Humanity.

What will become of this heretical land when the causes of this evil are eradicated?
[/quote]
The fourth pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the town of Salem in the year 1692 during the Salem witch trials. After the events of the [[Solomon (singularity) (fate/grand order)|Solomon singularity]], several [[demon pillar (fate)|]]s escaped and created subcategory singularities, resulting in the creation of Salem (among others). [spoiler]The demon pillar [[Raum (fate)|]] created a recreation of historical Salem and [[Abigail Williams (fate)|]], placing them in a time loop where he kept reiterating the same events in an attempt to summon the outer god Sut-Typhon.[/spoiler]

Released on the Japanese server on November 29, 2017 and on the NA server on December 2, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Oomori Aoi]].

Upon release of Salem (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

title: agartha_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Pseudo-Singularity II: Subterranean World of Folklore, Agartha[/b]
[quote]
The Demon God Pillars who were seperated from the 72 Demon Gods each found their purpose.
These scraps of the Beast scattered around the globe, forming Pseudo-Singularities—stains in the fabric of human history.
Central Asia, the 21st century.
In a time and place where no major conflicts were recorded, a Singularity has appeared underground, and a Demon God Pillar's influence is suspected.
The next Pseudo-Singularity operation will take place in the vast subterranean cavern Agartha.
[/quote]
The second pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in a massive underground world beneath the Asian continent in the year 2000. After the events of the [[Solomon (singularity) (fate/grand order)|Solomon singularity]], several [[demon pillar (fate)|]]s escaped and created subcategory singularities, resulting in the creation of Agartha (among others).

Released on the Japanese server on June 29, 2017 and on the NA server on June 21, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Takenaka Hideo]].

Upon release of Agartha (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

title: se.ra.ph_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Abyssal Cyber Paradise, SE.RA.PH[/b]
[quote]
"A resort event? You thought this would be a walk on the beach?
Welcome, all you foolish Masters!
The fate of the world rests in your silly, useless hands♥"

Our stage will be the Offshore Oil Rig, Seraphix, now a hellish recreation of the Moon Grail War.
This is a cage of ecstasy from which only one can escape.
Only moments remain until the base disintegrates.
And what is it that lurks at the bottom of this dance of Egos...?
[/quote]
[expand=Original Description]
[quote]
"Spring break means it's time for a trip!
It's a little early, but how about a beach event, foolish humans?"
The sudden arrival of the demonic digital brain BB throws Chaldea into a chaotic spring vacation.
A sweet, heated catfight ensues.
Fragile, pure, and sexy...
Look forward to an unforgettable resort event!
[/quote]
[/expand]

The extra pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the [[Chaldea Security Organization]]'s Seraphix oil rig, which has been displaced into the Mariana Trench in 2030 and transformed into a space resembling the Moon Cell from [[Fate/EXTRA CCC]]. It was initially presented as a collaboration event between Fate/Grand Order and Fate/EXTRA CCC, only to be revealed as a pseudo-singularity upon the event releasing.

Released on the Japanese server on May 1, 2017 and on the NA server on April 23, 2019. [[BB (fate/extra)|]] is given as a reward to players for completing the event. It was adapted into a manga by [[Nishiide Kengorou]].

title: shinjuku_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Pseudo-Singularity I: Quarantined Territory of Malice, Shinjuku[/b]
[quote]
When you untangle all of history, something massive must fall by the wayside.
A scenario penned by discarded madness.
Half-forgotten myths from the turn of the century.
This Pseudo-Singularity is a murder case of unprecedented scale.
The perfect crime is set in motion.
Dance through the decadent streets, you phantoms.
[/quote]
The first pseudo-singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the [[Japan]]ese ward of [[Shinjuku (tokyo)|]] in 1999. After the events of the [[Solomon (singularity) (fate/grand order)|Solomon singularity]], several [[demon pillar (fate)|]]s escaped and created subcategory singularities, resulting in the creation of Shinjuku (among others). Here the demon pillar Baal became able to fuse phantom spirits with heroic spirits due to the Counter Force being deactivated with its separation from human history, resulting in servants who wouldn't normally exist.

Released on the Japanese server on February 24, 2017 and on the NA server on February 24, 2019. It was adapted into a manga by [[Sasaki Shounen]].

Upon release of Shinjuku (and the other pseudo-singularities), the true name of several new servants was initially hidden; however official Fate/Grand Order media would later forego keeping their true names hidden in promotional materials. Their aliases are listed below, but their true names are used on Danbooru for tagging.

title: babylonia_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Seventh Singularity: Absolute Demonic Front, Babylonia[/b]
[quote]
2655 B.C.E. The seventh Grand Order.
This is the age when humans and gods first parted ways.
The Three Goddess Alliance, formed to destroy humanity.
A prophecy of destruction threatening to consume Uruk.
Facing ultimate demise, your greatest battle begins!
[/quote]
The seventh singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Set in the year 2655 BC in [[Mesopotamia]] during the reign of [[Gilgamesh (fate)|]]. In this singularity, the Three Goddess alliance end up summoning demonic beasts to overrun and destroy the civilization of Uruk. [spoiler]Over the course of the singularity, the beast [[Tiamat (fate)|]] manifests, serving as an even greater threat than that of [[Grand Caster (fate)|]].[/spoiler]

Released on the Japanese server on December 7, 2016 and on the NA server on December 5, 2018. It was adapted into 2 seasons of an anime by [[Cloverworks]], [i]Fate/Grand Order - Absolute Demonic Front: Babylonia[/i].

title: camelot_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Sixth Singularity: Divine Realm of the Round Table, Camelot[/b]
[quote]
The setting of the sixth Grand Order is the year 1273, a holy land where many gather to worship.
Gallant knights battle for the restoration of humanity in a kingdom scarred by a history that should not exist!
[/quote]

The sixth singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Set in the year 1273 in [[Jerusalem]], it was originally registered as a variation of the Ninth Crusade that was successful in reaching Jerusalem; however due to the summoning of the [[Lion King (Lancer) (Fate)|Lion King]] it instead became home to a recreation of the city of Camelot from Arthurian legend, with the Chaldean forces arriving 6 months later.

Released on the Japanese server on July 25, 2016 and on the NA server on June 28, 2018. It was adapted into 2 anime films, [i]Wandering; Agateram[/i] and [i]Paladin; Agateram[/i].

title: e_pluribus_unum_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Fifth Singularity: North American Myth War, E Pluribus Unum[/b]
[quote]
The fifth Grand Order moves to the year 1783.
Aspiring to become "from many, one," North America is embroiled in a war for independence.
This is an age when gods and legends still roamed the land.
The battle for the fifth Holy Grail has begun!
[/quote]

The fifth singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It's set in the year 1783 in the [[United States]] shortly after the American revolution, where [[Medb (fate)|]] utilizes her [[holy grail (fate)|]] to summon an [[alter servant|altered]] [[Cu Chulainn Alter (fate)|version]] of [[Cu Chulainn (fate)|]] to rule alongside her as king. The Celtics are opposed by the President-King [[Thomas Edison (fate)|]], with the Celts controlling the eastern half of the North American continent and the Americans controlling the western half. A resistance to both factions was later formed, being opposed to the actions of both parties.

Released on the Japanese server on March 30, 2016 and on the NA server on March 15, 2018.

title: okeanos_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Third Singularity: Sealed Ends of the Four Seas, Okeanos[/b]
[quote]
The third Grand Order is set in 1573.
This is the Age of Exploration where many pirates give their lives for endless treasures.
In this sealed sea, Okeanos, due to the Incineration of Humanity, legendary pirates will risk everything for the greatest treasure, the Holy Grail.
[/quote]
The third singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It's set in the year 1573 in an endless ocean, after [[Francis Drake (fate)|]] went on a voyage and encountered [[Poseidon (mythology)|]] in Atlantis, where she defeated him and acquired his [[holy grail (fate)|]]. Due to another holy grail being inserted in the era as part of the plot to incinerate humanity, the energy of the two competed together resulting in the endless ocean.

Released on the Japanese server on November 5, 2015 and on the NA server on September 28, 2017.

title: orleans_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]First Singularity: Hundred Years' War of the Evil Dragons, Orleans[/b]
[quote]
The first Grand Order is set in 1431 A.D. during the Hundred Years' War, a turbulent period for medieval France.
As the world faces the threat of abominable monsters, the fight to protect humanity begins.
[/quote]
The first proper singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. It's set in the year 1431 in [[France]], shortly after [[Jeanne d'Arc (ruler) (fate)|Jeanne d'Arc]] was burned at the stake, resulting in [[Gilles de Rais (caster) (fate)|Gilles de Rais]] attempting to utilize a [[holy grail (fate)|]] to revive her, instead creating an [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (avenger) (fate)|altered manifestation]] of her. title: fuyuki_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Singularity F: Flame Contaminated City, Fuyuki[/b]
[quote]
Disaster strikes Chaldea, the Security Organization for the Preservation of Humanity.
A lone Master is thrown into Fuyuki during the year 2004, where a Holy Grail War is raging.
The journey to reclaim human history begins in a desolate, burning city.
[/quote]
The tutorial singularity in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Technically the first singularity, but isn't numbered as such as it serves as a prologue, instead being known as Singularity F. It's set in the year 2004 in the Japanese town of Fuyuki, where a [[Fate/stay night|certain holy grail war]] has ended in disaster. It was adapted into the film [i][[Fate/Grand Order: First Order]][/i].

title: genie_(aladdin)
body:
The Genie is the tritagonist of Disney's 1992 animated feature film Aladdin. He is a larger-than-life jinn residing in a magic oil lamp originating from the Cave of Wonders. For thousands of years, the Genie served as a slave to whomever held ownership of his lamp, to which he was eternally bound unless granted freedom by a master. The Genie possesses phenomenal cosmic power that allows him to grant wishes, shapeshift, and transcend space and time.

The Genie is loosely based on the Genie of the Lamp featured in the One Thousand and One Nights folk tale Aladdin. The figure in the tale, while important, was portrayed as a mere slave while the [[Disney]] interpretation was greatly expanded into an identifiable character personality, the most notable difference being the Disney genie's ultimate wish to be free.

title: cathedral
body:
A [[church]] that contains the [i]cathedra[/i] (throne-like raised seat) of a bishop, thus serving as the central [[Building|church]] of a diocese, conference, or episcopate. 

Use this tag for larger churches with more ornate [[architecture]] that is usually influenced by [[Gothic architecture|Gothic]] or [[Europan architecture]] as well as the interior compared to regular churches.

title: koopalings
body:
A group of recurring, high-ranking [[koopa troopa|koopa]] characters from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. They generally appear as world bosses in each of the first seven worlds, where they are confronted in towers or [[airship]]s.

The Koopalings appear in many [[Super Nintendo|SNES]]-era games, before going on a long hiatus and eventually being redesigned for [[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]]. Since then, they have reappeared in numerous platformers and even as playable characters in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

The Koopalings are portrayed as [[siblings]], led by [[Ludwig von Koopa]], that serve under [[Bowser]] and were also originally depicted as his children. However, this was changed in [[New Super Mario Bros. Wii]] where they are now his minions, which was later "confirmed":https://gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2015/09/10/miyamoto-tezuka-interview.aspx by [[Miyamoto Shigeru]] in 2012. The Koopalings have varying abilities, but in general, they all use their [[turtle shell|shell]]s for offense and defense and are also skilled in [[magic]].

All of the Koopalings are named after famous musicians.

This tag should be used when all seven are present in the same picture

She is depicted as a [[long hair]]ed girl with feline attributes such as cat ears and a tail, perhaps a nod to her legend where she was turned into a lioness. She is usually shown wearing a green dress with puffy shoulders, a short skirt and [[bodice]], as well as clawed [[gauntlets]], [[thigh boots|thigh_boots]] and her [[bow (weapon)|bow]].

title: penthesilea_(fate)
body:
Berserker-class Servant first appearing in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Agartha (fate/grand order)|]] Singularity as the [b]Berserker of El Dorado[/b]. The Queen of the Amazons, she is a [[white hair]]ed [[toned]] woman who wields a [[spiked ball and chain]] with great skill. Strangely calm for a Berserker, except when she sees or hears [[Achilles (fate)|]], and that's when she starts freaking out in typical Berserker fashion. Her sister is [[Hippolyta (fate)|]].

Her Noble Phantasm is Outrage Amazon, where she makes herself see the enemy in front of her is Achilles, and proceeds to RIP AND TEAR at the hapless target.

title: paris_(fate)
body:
Archer-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The younger brother of [[Hector (fate)|]], who instigated the Trojan War by eloping with Helen, the queen of Sparta. Later in the war, Paris fatally wounds [[Achilles (fate)|]] by shooting an arrow at his heel, his only weak spot.

Summoned alongside [[Apollo (fate)|]] as a [[sheep]] [[stuffed animal|mascot]], similarly to [[Orion (Bear) (fate)|Orion]] with [[Artemis (fate)|]]. His manifestation isn't in his physical prime, but rather when Apollo thought he was the most shining, resulting in his [[androgynous]] [[trap]] appearance.

[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Terasaki Yuka]]

title: kazuradrop_(fate)
body:
Alter Ego-class Servant seen in [[Fate/Extra CCC Fox Tail]], and introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]] during the [[Celeb Summer Experience!]] event and the [[Archetype Inception (fate/grand order)|]] Ordeal Call. She appears as a younger version of [[Matou Sakura]].

Her floral namesakes are the "nepenthes rafflesiana":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepenthes_rafflesiana (known as the Utsubo-Kazura in Japanese) and the [[snowdrop (flower)|]]. Her component spirits include [[Murian (fate)|]] and the "Pixie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pixie. Murian herself appears in [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]] as a Kazuradrop [[look-alike]], and was included as a costume for Kazuradrop.

title: pom_pom_(mario)
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario 3D Land]]. Pom Pom appears as a female counterpart to [[Boom Boom]] and is usually guarding one of [[Bowser]]'s fortresses or [[airship]]s. She primarily attacks by throwing [[shuriken]]s or [[boomerang]]s and can clone her self.

Pom Pom is depicted as a large female [[koopa troopa|koopa]] with a red polka dot [[turtle shell|shell]], visible [[fangs]], [[claws]] and a [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[ponytail]] with two [[hair bobbles]]. Her skin is colored [[pink skin|pink]] and [[red skin|red]] rather than yellow.

title: boom_boom
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. After his appearance in [[Super Mario 3D Land]], Boom Boom has been reappearing more frequently. He serves as one of [[Bowser]]'s main henchman, usually guarding one his fortresses or [[airship]]s and primarily attacks by swinging his fists around.

Boom Boom is depicted as a large [[koopa troopa|koopa]] with a red [[turtle shell|shell]], visible [[fangs]], [[claws]] and two large arms. He may also have [[spikes]] on his shell depending on the game he is depicted in.

title: saw_sawing
body:
"Saw, Sawing" 
A large sculpture of a [[saw]] near [[Tokyo Big Sight]] by Claes Oldenburg and Coosje van Bruggen. 

Dimensions: 50 ft. 8 in. x 4 ft. 9 in. x 40 ft. (15.4 x 1. 5 x 12.2 m) 

It was commissioned in January 1995 and installed in March 1996. 

h4. Links 

* http://oldenburgvanbruggen.com/largescaleprojects/sawsawing.htm

title: saw
body:
A saw is a [[tools|tool]] consisting of a hard blade, wire, or chain with a toothed edge. It is used to cut through relatively hard material, most often wood. 
The cut is made by placing the toothed edge against the material and moving it forcefully back and forth.

title: shishiro_botan_(5th_costume)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Shishiro Botan]].

It consists of a [[white veil|white]] [[see-through veil]], a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with an [[underbust]] [[white corset]] and a [[grey overskirt|grey]] [[overskirt]], [[long sleeves|long]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]], [[white thighhighs|white]] [[detached leggings]] and [[white shoes]]. Her hair now has a [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair|gradient]], and she also now has a starry sky pattern on the inside of her ears and a [[tail ribbon]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[very long hair|very long]] [[messy hair]] with [[long sleeves]], [[swept bangs]], [[hair flaps]] and a [[long hair between eyes|long lock between her eyes]] and optional [[twintails]].

title: boros_(ouro_kronii)
body:
A small [[white snake]] with [[|_|]] eyes and a small [[blue bow]], introduced as part of [[Ouro Kronii]]'s [[ouro kronii (new Year)|New Year]]'s outfit in January 2022 and eventually becoming a mascot for her channel. Despite the bow they are referred to as "he" by Kronii, thus he is often depicted as a [[trap]] in [[personification]] fanart, with the most popular design being the one first depicted in post #7431894.

The names Ouro and Boros are derived from the [[ouroboros]], a symbol of eternity.

title: yuki_miku_(2012)
body:
"Fluffy White Coat" / ふわふわコート ([i]fuwafuwa kooto[/i])

The 2012 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. This is the first version to have been decided by a design contest. The theme of the contest was a gemstone that resembles snow or ice, with the winning entry by [[Nanatun (Nanaka)]].

Her fan nickname is "Fuwako".

She wears a [[blue coat|blue]] [[fur-trimmed coat]], [[thigh boots]], [[mittens]], and a blue [[hair ribbon]] where the [[gem]] is attached.

title: yuki_miku_(2013)
body:
"Strawberry White Dress" / いちご白無垢 ([i]ichigo shiro muku[/i])

The 2013 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme this year was お菓子 (Sweets) showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter, with the winning design by [[nijita18]] having an [[ichigo daifuku]] motif.

Her fan nickname is "Shiromuku".

She has [[green hair|green]] or [[aqua hair]] and wears a white [[shiromuku]] with a [[wataboushi]] while often holding an [[oil-paper umbrella]].

title: jessica_drew
body:
The civilian identity of [[Spider-Woman]], who despite common belief has next to nothing to do with the original [[Spider-Man]].

While the original comic version of Jessica is a standalone character, modern depictions associate her with the Spider-Man Mythos. The Ultimate universe version is a female clone of [[Peter Parker]] who retains Peter's abilities, memories, and feelings towards other characters.

For the version of Jessica from [[Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse]] see [[Jessica Drew (Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse)]].

title: spider-woman
body:
A [[Marvel]] superhero, civilian identity: [[Jessica Drew]]. 

It's a common misconception that she is a "Female [[Spider-Man]]". In reality, her powers, abilities, origin story, and overall function are separate from his. She is a spy, and in practice has more in common with [[Black Widow]].

[[Stan Lee]] insisted on creating her so that Marvel could copyright the name "Spider-Woman". as Marvel was previously sued for its "Wonder Man" series on account of DC's [[Wonder Woman (Series)|Wonder Woman]], only for DC to create [[Power Girl]] in spite of Marvel's [[Luke Cage]] (Then known as "Power Man"). 

As a result, Spider-Woman kinda sat around their portfolio, unsure what to do with her until the [[Secret War]], [[Civil War]], and [[Secret Invasion]] comics in the mid-late 2000s.

Despite this, modern depictions associate her with the Spider-Man mythos. The Ultimate Universe depicts her as a literal female clone of [[Peter Parker]]. Sony Picture Animation's [i]Spider-Verse[/i] film series depicts her [[Jessica Drew (Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse)|as a straight up "Spider-Woman"]] 

The "Spider-Woman" mantle has also been briefly held by other female Spider-heroes such as [[Mayday Parker]]/[[Spider-Girl]] and [[Gwen Stacy]]/[[Spider-Gwen]]. Most of these cases were only temporary, or only used by that character in their home universe, and neither changed costumes to go with the name.

title: yuki_miku_(2014)
body:
"Magical Snow"

The 2014 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was "magical girl" with the image of Hokkaido winter and snow. The winning entry was done by [[dera fury]], featuring a magician design with a large white [[witch hat]], white [[cloak]], purple [[fingerless gloves]], and a [[snow globe]] [[wand]].

Her fan nickname is "Namara-chan".

This year marked the 5th anniversary of Snow Miku. She was the first Snow Miku to receive an official theme song: "[[Suki! Yuki! Maji Magic (Vocaloid)|Suki! Yuki! Maji Magic]]" by Mitchie M. A pet design contest for Snow Miku was held as well, with the winner being [[Rabbit Yukine]].

body:
"Snow Bell"

The 2015 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme for the design contest this year was "Plants of Hokkaido's Winter". The winning entry was a lily-of-the-valley design by [[Taran (tara ran125)|]]. 

Her fan nickname is [i]Pokkuru-chan[/i] in reference to the [[koropokkuru]].

She has a [[lily of the valley]] motif with [[hair flower]] and a [[bell]], wears a white [[capelet]] and  snowdrop-shaped [[bubble skirt]] decorated with [[rowan]] fruit ribbons and buttons.

title: miles_morales
body:
Tag refers to any image referencing the [[Marvel|Marvel Comics]] character Miles Morales, one of many alternative versions of the iconic superhero [[Spider-Man]]. 

Most versions of Miles depict him as an African-American teen boy with either a faded buzz cut or dreadlocks. He [[superhero costume|wears]] a [[Spider-Man (Miles Morales)|variation]] of the iconic Spider-Man suit with a black base and red outlines instead of red and blue. 

He debuted in the Ultimate universe in the wake of the original's untimely death, struggling to live up to Peter Parker's legacy, the responsibilities, and isolation that come with his newfound powers.

He was created in the early 2010s, notable for being the first (widely recognized) Spider-Man of African and Latino ancestry. While others, such as Spider-Punk and Spider-Man 2099, existed, Miles was created near the end of President Barack Obama's first term, in part because of what Obama represented to his supporters as the first black president of the United States. This allowed Marvel to push him into the attention of their most dedicated fans.

Marvel was soon able to make him a household name with his appearances in the Insomniac Games' [[Spider-Man (2018 game)|Spider-Man games]], Sony Picture Animation's [i][[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse|Into The Spider-Verse]][/i], and numerous children's cartoons in the late 2010s.

title: karolina_dean
body:
Karolina Dean is a [[Marvel]] Comics character that debuted in [[Runaways (Marvel)|Runaways]] #1 (July 2003), which was released under Marvel's Tsunami print, aiming to appeal to Manag readers.

Upon discovering her parents are part of an evil organization known as The Pride, she rebels alongside other teenagers under the same revelation. She also discovers she's part of an alien race known as Majesdanians, with the ability to manipulate solar energy.

title: nico_minoru
body:
Nico Minoru, briefly known as Sister Grimm, is a [[Marvel]] Comics character that debuted in [[Runaways (Marvel)|Runaways]] #1 (July 2003), which was released under Marvel's Tsunami print, aiming to appeal to Manag readers.

Upon discovering her parents are part of an evil organization known as The Pride, she rebels alongside other teenagers under the same revelation. She also discovers she's a powerful witch.

title: seia_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[Tea Party (blue_archive)|]]. Her full name is Yurizono Seia.

She is a [[fox girl]] with [[fox ears]], [[fox tail]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], [[gradient eyes|gradient]] [[pink eyes|pink]]-[[yellow eyes]], and a [[cross halo|cross-shaped]] [[yellow halo|yellow]] [[halo]]. She wears a [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[detached sleeves]] that go [[sleeves past fingers|past her fingers]], and [[petticoat]] under her dress. She wears a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] and [[hair flower]] on her head.

Sometimes drawn with a [[white bird]], often a [[long-tailed tit]], perched on her.

Her firearm is a [[webley_self_loading_pistol|Webley M1913]] pistol.

Voiced by: [[Tanezaki Atsumi]]
Original artist: [[kokosando]]

title: new_mutants
body:
A sub-franchise within [[Marvel|Marvel's]] [[X-Men]] series, starring a junior class of mutants within Xavier's school.

It was released under Marvel's 2003 Tsunami print, aiming to appeal to manga readers. It, alongside [[Runaways (Marvel)|Runaways]] , [[Mystique]], and  [[Sentinel (X-Men)|Sentinel]] went on to be relatively successful, while [[Venom (Marvel)|Venom]], [[Human Torch]], and [[Namor]] faded into obscurity.

body:

Voice provider for the [[CeVIO]] voicebank [[SEKAI (cevio)|]].

She has her [[hair over eyes|hair covering her right eye]]. Has [[heterochromia]] with her left eye being [[grey eyes|grey]] and her right eye, which is usually covered, being [[red eyes|red]]. She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with [[red hair|red]] or [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], depending on her outfit.

She usually wears two [[anemone (flower)|]]-like [[hair flower]]s, but depending on her outfit, they may resemble other flowers. Besides, sometimes she is seen accompanied by a [[living clothes|sentient]] [[anemone (flower)|]] creature called Anemos (as seen in post #4672659).

title: cardiogram
body:

body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Ice witch of the [[Make-Up Work Club (blue archive)|]]. [spoiler]Former member of [[Arius Squad (blue archive)|]][/spoiler]. Her full name is Shirasu Azusa.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[crossed bangs]] that reach [[hair between eyes|between the eyes]], [[purple eyes|purple]] to [[pink eyes]], [[low wings|low]] [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]], and a [[yellow halo|yellow]] [[crescent halo|crescent]] [[halo]]. She wears a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress|black]] [[dress]] with [[dress flower|flower]] and [[petticoat]], [[hair flower]] and [[black ribbon|black]] [[hair ribbon|hair]] [[ribbon]], [[yellow ribbon|yellow]] [[neck ribbon|neck]] [[ribbon]], [[loose socks|loose]] [[frilled socks|frilled]] [[black socks|black]] [[socks]] with [[ankle flower]], [[white shoes|white]] [[mary janes]], [[black sailor collar|black]] [[sailor collar]], and a [[open jacket|open]] [[white jacket|white]] [[jacket]] with [[puffy long sleeves]]. Uses a white [[M4 Carbine]] with [[latin text|latin]] [[blackletter]] inscription.

Voiced by: [[Taneda Risa]]

title: nagisa_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[tea_party_(blue_archive)|Tea Party]]. Her full name is Kirifuji Nagisa.

She has [[long hair|long]] light [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]]. Her usual hairstyle is a [[crown braid]] with [[double-parted bangs]] and decorate with a pair of [[hair flower]]s.

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shrug]] worn over a [[white dress|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[sailor dress]] with [[long sleeves]] (which gives her [[short over long sleeves]]), a [[white sailor collar]] with a [[black neckerchief]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[pumps]]. She also has a [[chest harness]] with a [[holster]] hanging from it.

Her personal weapon is a [[Walther]] [[Walther PPK|PP]] [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Hayami Saori]]

title: topless_female
body:
Nude from the waist up. Not wearing a top, but wearing bottoms. For example, wearing [[pants]] or a [[skirt]] without a [[shirt]] or [[bra]].

h6. Guidelines

* Don't use when the character is [[nude]] or [[completely nude]].
* Don't use when you can't see the character's lower body. You should be able to tell the character is wearing bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use if the character is wearing a [[bra]] or [[bikini top only|bikini top]]. Use [[no shirt]] instead.
* Don't use [[bare shoulders]], [[bare back]], or [[bare arms]] with this tag.
* Don't use this tag for male characters. [[Topless female]] is for female characters only. See [[topless male]] for male characters.
* Don't use for [[monster girl]]s who don't normally wear bottom clothing. Use [[nude]] instead.
* Don't use this tag if the character is wearing only a [[corset]].
* Wearing [[pasties]], [[suspenders]] or [[midriff sarashi]] still counts as topless female.

h4. See also

* [[bottomless]]
* [[no bra]]
* [[no shirt]]
* [[topless male]]
* [[topless other]]
* [[Tag Group:Sexual Attire]]

title: ako_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Executive officer of the [[Prefect Team (blue archive)|]]. Her firearm is [[Luger P08]]. Her full name is Amau Ako. 

She has an [[aqua halo|aqua]] to [[blue halo|blue]] [[crescent halo]], [[medium hair|medium]] to [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]], and  [[large breasts]]. Her regular hairstyle has [[sidelocks]] going [[hair behind ear|behind her ears]] and [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulders]], [[double-parted bangs]] going [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], and is decorated with a [[black hairband|black]] [[bow hairband]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon]]. She wears black [[earrings]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sideless_shirt|sideless]] [[collared shirt]] that exposes her [[sideboob]]s, a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[double-breasted]] [[blue jacket]] that goes [[framed breasts|around]] and [[underbust|under]] her breasts, a [[neck bell|neck]] [[cowbell]] , [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[shackles|shackle]] on her left wrist, a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[black garter straps]], [[ankle strap]]s and [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear|platform shoes]] with [[colored shoe soles]].

Voiced by: [[Kouno Marika]]

title: firelock
body:
An [[antique firearm]] that uses an external mechanism to ignite the gunpowder, instead of using a modern self-contained [[cartridge]].

The firing mechanisms this tag includes are, from oldest to newest: 

* [[Matchlock]]: A burning match cord is used to ignite the powder.
* [[Wheellock]]: A piece of pyrite strikes a spinning wheel of steel to produce sparks that ignite the powder.
* [[Flintlock]]: A hammer holding flint strikes a piece of steel to produce sparks that ignite a pan of gunpowder.
* [[Caplock]]: A hammer strikes a percussion cap that ignites the gunpowder in the barrel.

If the weapon's firing mechanism is easily identifiable, use one of the more specific tags under this tag. If the weapon's firing mechanism is not easily identifiable, but is recognizable as a pre-cartridge firing mechanism, then just use this tag only and do not guess at one of the more specific types. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8728277: [[Matchlock]]
* !post #6023112: [[Wheellock]]
* !post #8918689: [[Flintlock]]
* !post #3423270: [[Caplock]]

h4. See also

* [[Antique firearm]] 
* [[Arquebus]]
* [[Musket]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Lock (firearm)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lock_(firearm)]

title: caplock
body:
A [[firelock]] mechanism where a hammer strikes a percussion cap lined with filament mercury, which  ignites and sends flame into the barrel, setting off the gunpowder inside. Was much more reliable than the [[flintlock]], which it replaced, but it was replaced in turn just half a century later by the advent of self-contained [[cartridge]]s, which eliminated the need for an external lock system altogether. 

The time period for the use of caplocks is almost exclusively the mid-19th Century: the Mexican-American War, [[Crimean War]], [[American Civil War]], and [[Boshin War]]. Though some caplocks would continue to be used in the American West, most would be converted by various methods to use cartridges.

h4. Examples

* !post #3423270

h4. See also

* [[Antique firearm]]
* [[Firelock]]
** [[Matchlock]]
** [[Wheellock]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Percussion cap":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Percussion_cap]

title: flintlock
body:
A [[firelock]] mechanism where a hammer holding flint strikes a piece of steel and produces sparks. The sparks fall into a pan of gunpowder and ignites the powder. A small hole from the pan to the barrel allows flame to travel and ignite the powder in the barrel. Thanks to its cheap cost and ease of use, the flintlock fully replaced the [[matchlock]] and [[wheellock]], and was the primary firearm mechanism until it was replaced in turn by the [[caplock]].

General time periods for the use of flintlocks span from the late [[Renaissance]] circa ~1610s to the [[Napoleonic Wars]] of the 1810s, including the Golden Age of Piracy, [[American Revolution]], and War of 1812 among many other world events. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8918689

h4. See also

* [[Antique firearm]]
** [[Musket]]
* [[Firelock]]
** [[Caplock]]
** [[Matchlock]]
** [[Wheellock]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flintlock":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flintlock

title: masegohan
body: Artist.

title: wheellock
body:
A mechanism to fire an [[antique firearm]] that was the technological successor to the [[matchlock]]. It used a small arm, called a "dog", to hold a piece of pyrite that would strike down against a spinning wheel of steel to produce sparks. These sparks would ignite a pan of gunpowder that would send flames through a small hole in the barrel to ignite the powder in it.

Due to the complicated design and high cost, it never fully replaced the matchlock, and instead both match and wheellocks would be replaced by the cheaper and less complicated [[flintlock]].

General time period of use would be the mid [[Renaissance]] era. 

h4. Examples

* !post #6023112

h4. See also

* [[Firelock]]

h4. External link

* "Wikipedia: Wheellock":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wheellock]

title: matchlock
body:
The first firing mechanism or "lock" used in [[antique firearm]]s. It used an arm that held a burning piece of match cord that would be lowered into a pan of powder that would ignite the firearm. This mechanism could be as simple as an "S" shaped lever called a [i]serpentine[/i] that would lower the arm into the pan or it could use a locking mechanism and spring that upon releasing the lock would "snap" the arm rapidly into the pan. The latter type of matchlock were referred to as "snap matchlocks." Most [[arquebus|arquebuses]], including the Japanese tanegashima, were matchlocks.

General time periods for use include the late Medieval to early [[Renaissance]] eras, including Japan's [[Sengoku Jidai]].

This firing mechanism was theoretically replaced by the [[wheellock]], but due to cost, would not be completely replaced until the [[flintlock]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8728277

h4. See also

* [[Antique firearm]]
* [[Firelock]]
** [[Caplock]]
** [[Wheellock]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: m45_meusoc
body:
The MEU(SOC) [[handgun|pistol]], ("[b]M[/b]arine [b]e[/b]xpeditionary [b]u[/b]nit ([b]s[/b]pecial [b]o[/b]perations [b]c[/b]apable)") officially designated the M45 MEUSOC is an [[M1911]] variant. It became the sidearm for the Force Recon Element of the [[United States Marine Corps|USMC's]] Marine Expeditionary Units since 1985. The [[gun|handgun]] features some modernized features like longer pointy back spur, skeletonized external hammer, dovetail rear sights, a wraparound Pachmayr grip and a lighter trigger with hole(s). 

This also applies to its most recent variant, the M45A1 CQBP which was introduced in 2012. Visually identifiable by its railed dust cover, diagonal front slide serrations and desert tan coloring.

h4. Examples

* !post #6334159: M45 MEUSOC (bottom) and [[M1911]] (top).

title: m1911
body:
An American single-action, semi-automatic [[handgun]] designed by [[John Moses Browning]]. Its short-recoil operation with a reciprocating slide highly influenced modern pistol designs.

The [[M1911]] is visually identifiable by its external hammer, a beaver tail safety, both grip panels being held by two [[screw]]s and a thumb safety. Chambered for the .45 ACP [[cartridge]], the standard [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] capacity is seven rounds. In 1924, the M1911 was largely revised into the [B]M1911A1[/B], with a shorter trigger and a longer back spur. It was the standard sidearm of the [[United States|U.S.]] [[military]] from 1911 to 1985.

This tag applies to any M1911-styled handgun, regardless of specific model. 
h4. Examples

* !post #6334159
* !post #765582: Custom M1911 with a skeletonized trigger.

title: cherrim
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0421 in the National Pokédex, a Grass-type.

Resembles an anthropomorphic [[cherry blossoms|cherry blossom]]. Has two forms: [[Cherrim (Overcast)|Overcast Form]] and [[Cherrim (Sunshine)|Sunshine Form]]; it changes into the latter in harsh [[sunlight]].

In its Overcast Form, two purple petals enclose its deep pink body. A short red stem and a green leafy sepal sprout from the top of the petals. Its eyes are near its short legs, and they are usually seen [[closed eyes|closed]], with the right eye [[one eye covered|covered]].

In its Sunshine Form, it "blooms," revealing its [[red eyes]]. Pink petals surround its head and cover its chest.

Evolves from [[Cherubi]].

Japanese name: [b]Cherrim[/b]

h4. Appearance

* !post #9459954: [[Cherrim (Overcast)|Overcast]]

body:
Also called service ribbon or medal ribbon. They are often a part of [[military uniform|military]] or [[police uniform|police]] [[uniform]]s, and usually appear as the colorful stripes seen above one of the breast pockets.

Ribbon bars are pieces of fabric mounted on a small metal bar equipped with an attaching device. They represent various awards or accomplishments of the individual or of the sub-group (squad, division, platoon, etc.) the individual is a part of.

An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Lillie (Pokemon)|]] in [[Pokemon Masters EX]].

[[Lillie (pokemon)|]] took part in a musical ensemble to perform at a party. She is playing soft tunes alongside her partner, [[Primarina]], who hatched from an Egg that [[Elio (pokemon)|]] gave her.

title: darjeeling_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]]. Tank commander of a [[Churchill (Tank)|]], and overall leader of the St. Gloriana tankery team.

Her nickname is based on Darjeeling tea. Her real name is unknown.

Her [[catchphrase]] is こんな言葉をしってる？(Konna kotoba wo shitteru?, [tn]Do you know this saying?[/tn]).

Voiced by [[Kitamura Eri]].

title: bras_d'honneur
body:
"Arm of Honor" in French, a rude [[gesture]] usually consisting of one arm, bent at ninety degrees and turned upward, while the opposite hand sits in the crook of the elbow or grips the bicep. What someone chooses to do with the hand of the upturned arm may differ. 

Commonly seen around the world as a full-body "fuck you", equivalent in meaning to the, and often used together with, the [[middle finger]].

In Japanese culture, however, it's perceived as a form of muscle [[flexing]], indicating confidence and determination.

h4. Examples

* !post #3856775

h4. External links

* " Wikipedia: Bras d'honneur":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bras_d'honneur
other_names: お姉ちゃんに任せなさい

title: gochuumon_wa_usagi_desu_ka?
body:
A [[4koma]] slice-of-life manga by [[Koi (koisan)|]], serialized in Houbunsha's [[Manga Time Kirara|Manga Time Kirara MAX]] since 2011. Abbreviated as "gochiusa" and localized as "Is the order a rabbit?". The story follows characters' [[cafe]] jobs and school life in a Europe-themed Japanese town home to many [[rabbit]]s. h4. title: mask_bikini
body:
A [[mouth mask]] worn [[mask on breasts|on the breasts]] as a [[bra]] or a [[bikini]] top.

This is typically is shown in various ways, but generally in a creative ad hoc fashion involving tying, interlocking, or otherwise binding multiple masks together to be worn as a larger outfit (see post #3830413), sometimes also incorporating [[mask panties]]. Ironically, the character involved may or may not additionally being wearing a mask properly over their face. This theme developed in response to the [[coronavirus pandemic]] of 2020 where mask usage was brought into stark focus.

For the converse of this tag, where a [[bra]] or bikini top is used as a [[mask]], see [[bra on head]] or [[bikini top on head]]. For bikini tops that aren't actually made of mouth masks, but which adopt the specific strapless design associated with mask bikinis, see [[eyepatch bikini]].

h4. Examples

* !post #4114642
* !post #4329843

h4. See also

* [[surgical mask]]

* [[mask on crotch]]
* [[mask panties]]

title: princess_knight_riyona
body:
[B]Princess Knight RIYONA[/B] is the first and currently only character featured in Studio S' [[KNIGHTLOID]] project. She is a vocal synthesizer with several erotic voice samples meant for H-games, specifically specializing in the [[ryona]] genre.

title: bougu
body:
A type of [[armor]] used in [[kendo]] and other Japanese weapons-based martial arts. It's composed of four parts:

* [[Kendo mask]]: Combined face mask & shoulder protection.
* [[Kote]]: Hand and forearm protection, usually with a mitten-like glove.
* [[Dou]]: A breastplate for chest & stomach protection.
* Tare ([[faulds]]): A belt of heavy cloth flaps to protect the groin and waist.  The center flap often has a place for the name of who the competitor is representing.

Practitioners of [i]naginatajutsu[/i] also wear [[suneate]] (shin-guards).

h4. Examples

* !asset #31140977
* !post #9112855

h4. See also

* [[List of armor]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Bōgu":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bōgu
* "Wikipedia (JP): 防具_(剣道)":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/防具_(剣道)

title: carnival_mask
body:
A [[mask]] typically worn at a [[carnival]] or [[festival]], such as [[Mardi Gras]] or the Mexican [[dia_de_muertos|Día de Muertos]].

The areas most commonly covered by these masks are the full face, [[half mask|one half]] of the face, or [[eye mask|only the eyes]].

These masks are often characterized by flamboyant [[tag_group:colors|colors and patterns]], materials such as lace, sequins, and feathers, and a matching costume, though these are not requirements.

h4. Examples

* !post #2021378: Full-face carnival masks.
* !post #6645063: [[skull mask|Skull-shaped masks]] for a Día de Muertos festival.
* !post #5041546: A [[domino mask]] and an [[eye mask]] 
* !post #7905891: A [[white mask|white]] [[half mask]].

h4. See also

* [[Domino mask]] 
* [[Masquerade mask]]

title: enpera
body:
When hair poofs out above a [[scarf]] (or similar apparel, like [[headphones around neck]]).

It is named after the fins near the tip of the mantle of the Japanese flying [[squid]], which in turn takes its name from Emperor [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] due to the fins' resemblance to his [[bicorne]].

Users on pixiv largely refer to this look as えんぺら (enpera), but on other sites such as Nicoseiga the term マフモコ (mafumoko) may also be used. This phrase in particular is a contraction of two words: マフラー (muffler, [[scarf]]) and モコ (moko, onomatopoeia for soft and fluffy).

h4. Examples

* !post #6917281
* !post #6068683

h4. External links

* "Pixivision: Enpera collection!":https://www.pixivision.net/en/a/268
* "Pixivision: Enpera Collection 2 (Scarves!)":https://www.pixivision.net/en/a/972
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Enpera":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%81%88%E3%82%93%E3%81%BA%E3%82%89
* "Nico Nico Pedia: Enpera":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/%E3%81%88%E3%82%93%E3%81%BA%E3%82%89

title: rice_hat
body:
A cone-shaped [[hat]] made of [[straw hat|straw]] or matting traditionally worn by rice harvesters in several Asian countries. It is kept in place by a [[chin strap]] or an internal headband. It can be dipped in water and worn as an impromptu evaporative cooling device.

Very similar to [[ajirogasa]], a hat made of wicker or bamboo that is worn by [[priest]]s, not farmers.

A variant made of metal, wood or hardened leather worn by [[soldier]]s and [[samurai]]s is called [[jingasa]].

h4. Examples

* !post #8793020
* !post #4201045

title: colt_1851_navy
body:
A .36 caliber cap and ball [[revolver]] designed by Samuel Colt in the 1840s, and one of the most common pistols used in the [[American Civil War]]. The weapon is visually distinguished by its squared-off trigger guard and its hexagonal barrel. 

The Colt Navy gained particular prominence in Japan where it was one of several weapons purchased en-masse for the [[Boshin War]], as its smaller size and weight relative to many pistols of the time made it more comfortable to carry and use. In anime, the Colt 1851 Navy is the signature weapon of [[Kino (Kino No Tabi)|]] from [[Kino No Tabi]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Colt 1860 Army]]
* [[Colt M1851N (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Colt 1851 Navy Revolver":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colt_1851_Navy_Revolver]

title: the_feeshe_(meme)
body:
A [[Danbooru (site)|]] [[meme]] born from approver drama surrounding a [[still life]] drawing created by [[Tsukumizu Yuu]], its name coined in the "comments":[/posts/7412460#comment_2432584].

It was initially uploaded by user #521113 without being submitted for approval, and it was flagged nearly three months later. This would inspire a series of counter-approvals and counter-flags, and quickly spiraled into a discussion on approver ethics which would be continued with posts such as post #8503434 and topic #31568.

The image itself depicts at the center a blue [[plate]] with a [[grilled fish]] on a [[placemat]]. Surrounding it are a [[bowl]] of [[soup]], a small loaf of [[bread]], a red liquid in a [[glass]], and [[chopsticks]] resting on a [[chopstick rest]]. Superimposed upon this scene is the word [b]correctness[/b].

h4. Original

* !post #7412460: post #7412460

* [[faucet]]

title: scarlet_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the Pioneer squad along with [[Snow White (Nikke)|Snow White]] and [[Rapunzel (Nikke)|Rapunzel]]. She's a wandering swordswoman who's partial to a good drink. Despite the common perception of melee weapons being ineffective in combat, she chooses to wield a [[sword]]. [spoiler] Although she likes [[alcohol]], she doesn't hold it very well and can easily get [[drunk]]. [/spoiler]

Like all members of Pioneer, Scarlet is named after a figure from folklore: the titular character Hongryeon (which is Scarlet's name in Korean) from the Korean folktale "The Legend of Janghwa and Hongryeon":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janghwa_Hongryeon_jeon].

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[grey hair|grey]] [[long hair]] and [[medium breasts]]. She carries a [[sword]] which she keeps in her [[sheath]] on her [[weapon on back|back]]. She wears a [[large hat|large]] [[jingasa]], a [[white leotard]], resembling some sort of [[japanese armor]] with [[clothing cutout|cutouts]]. Wears a few pieces of japanese armor though reduced in size [[sode]] for her left arm, [[kote]] on her right arm, and a single sided left thigh protector [[haidate]].

h4. Appearance

title: fuura_yuri
body:
An English [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] formerly associated with [[Phase Connect]]. Originally named [b]Amaris Yuri[/b], she officially changed her VTuber name to Fuura Yuri in November of 2022.

She originally debuted as a member of [[Cyberlive]]'s first generation on July 16, 2021. She left the group on March 31, 2022 and briefly continued activity as an [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie Vtuber]] before joining Phase Connect as part of the Phase Invaders unit on April 15, 2022. On April 23, 2023 her contract with Phase was terminated due to multiple breaches of contract during her time with them, resulting in her YouTube channel, Twitter account, and all other official social media pages being wiped.

She was a [[leopard girl]] with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. For her costume, she originally worn a [[brown dress]] with [[paw print pattern|paw prints]] on it, [[black thighhighs|black]] [[leopard print]] [[thighhighs]] and [[blue boots]].

body:

She is officially illustrated by [[Teshima Nari]] and has long black hair in [[side braids]], [[green eyes]], and [[glasses]]. She wears a school uniform consisting of blue [[blazer]], blue [[miniskirt]], [[green necktie]] and [[green vest]].

She is a 1st year student at the fictitious [[otaru_(hokkaido)|Otaru]] Shiokaze Highschool along with her fellow classmates and club members 2nd year [[Koharu Rikka]] and 3rd year [[Natsuki Karin]]. Her birthday is on March 2nd. She is voiced by [[Okuno Kaya]].

title: montgomery_burns
body:
One of the many characters of the American animated comedy sitcom [[The Simpsons]].

Referred to by most other characters as "Mr. Burns", he is the wealthy owner of Springfield's nuclear power plant and the boss of [[Homer Simpson]]. He is practically always accompanied by his assistant and personal caretaker [[Waylon Smithers]].

He is a very skinny old man with [[balding]] white hair and a long sharp nose. He wears a [[blue suit]] and his catchphrase is "Excellent", which he often says with [[steepled fingers]].
other_names: チャールズ・モンゴメリー・バーンズ社長

title: queen_draco_(fate)
body:
Beast-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order Arcade]]. Initially appears as an [[aged down]] version of [[Nero Claudius (Fate/Extra)|]], but this is considered her immature state. Her mature form is referred to as [b][[queen draco (beast vi/s) (fate)|Beast VI/S]][/b], with the S representing "Sodom":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sodom_and_Gomorrah.

The immature form of Queen Draco can be obtained as a welfare SSR Alter Ego Servant - as of this writing, the only five-star rarity welfare Servant throughout all of FGO and FGOA. She is later introduced into the mobile game as a summonable Beast-class Servant, making her the first playable Beast in the entire franchise, with a unique summoning animation included. The character card for the Beast class uses her matured Beast VI/S form as the representative.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Wada Arco]] (Draco), [[Yamanaka Kotetsu]] ([[Queen Draco (Beast VI/S) (fate)|Beast VI/S]])
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Tange Sakura]]

title: ember_amane
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]. The rebranded character of [[Yazaki Kallin]], Ember was first unveiled as an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] with a preliminary design in December 2022, and later made her official debut as a member of [[Phase Connect]] on May 27, 2023.

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[large breasts]] and an [[ahoge]]. For her default outfit, she wears a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[black jacket]] worn over a [[red tube top]], [[grey gloves|grey]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], a [[thigh strap]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]

h4. Costumes

She is portrayed with [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]], and a [[prosthetic leg|prosthetic right leg]]. Her default hairstyle is [[long hair|shoulder-length]] [[black hair]] with [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] throughout, and [[asymmetrical bangs|bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and [[black pants]] under a [[blue coat|dark blue]] [[trench coat]], along with [[fingerless gloves]], a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[stiletto heels]]. title: chubby_(genshin_impact)
body:
Chubby is a Teapot Spirit and an open-world NPC that appears in the [[Serenitea pot (genshin impact)|]] in [[Genshin Impact]]. He is the Teapot Traveling Salesman and only appears in the Teapot on certain days of the week, namely Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Interacting with him allows players to purchase unique furnishings and Radiant Spincrystals which allow players to change the background music of their realm.

He takes on the form of a large black [[finch]] with orange and white markings around his beak. He resides in a floating green and white [[teapot]] with it's lid being worn as a hat. 

h4. See also
* [[Tubby (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Madame Ping (genshin impact)|]]

title: tubby_(genshin_impact)
body:
Tubby is a Teapot Spirit and an open-world NPC that appears in the [[Serenitea pot (genshin impact)|]] in [[Genshin Impact]]. Interacting with her allows players to access many features of the Serenitea Pot system.

She takes on the form of a large blue [[finch]] with orange and white markings around her beak. Her design changes depending on the player's Trust Rank, but she initially resides on a floating tea [[saucer]] and later inside of a floating blue and white [[teapot]] with it's lid being worn as a hat. 

h4. See also
* [[Madame Ping (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Chubby (genshin impact)|]]

title: machine_tool
body: Machine tools are any powered [[industrial]] machine that are used to physically alter any materials (e.g. metals) into specific shape or remove an precise amount of the material off from the work-piece, by positioning or spinning the tools or work-piece (depending on type of the machine tool that being used, usually a [[lathe]] or [[milling machine]]) to create an useful product. These machine are usually found in [[workshop]]s or larger industrial areas such as  [[factory|factories]], and people who are trained and work to use them as their profession are called machinists.

title: duke_kashchey_(arknights)
body:
A Npc character from [[Arknights]]. A nobleman from the Ursus Empire, he adopted [[talulah (arknights)|Talulah]] as his heir after she ran away from Lungmen. 

In truth, [spoilers]Duke Kashchey is the actually antagonist of the Reunion arc and the reason for Reunion's radicalization from a peaceful group fighting for the rights of the Infected to an extremist militant group. After failing to convince Talulah of his Social Darwinist beliefs which led to Talulah killing him, Kashchey tried to possesses Talulah's body, which he succeeded after Talulah suffered several tragic events, including the death of her best friend [[Alina (arknights)|Alina]]. Now in possession of Talulah's body, Kashchey manipulates and radicalize Reunion and it's members as part of his plans to start a war between Ursus and the Yan Empire. Eventually he is defeated and his plans foiled after Rhodes Island learns the truth with [[Amiya (Arknights)|Amiya]] forcing Kashchey out of Talulah's body. Currently Kashchey is possessing a new body under the name [[koshelna (arknights)|Koshelna]].[/spoilers]
other_names: コシチェイ(アークナイツ)

title: hagoromo
body:
A [b]hagoromo[/b] (羽衣, lit. "Feather Robe") is a long, thin [[shawl]] often associated with far-east celestial beings and deities.

Despite being thin, it is often depicted being able to remain upright in the air on its own. The cloth was modeled after ancient China's clothing called, [i]pi-bo[/i] (披帛).

Tales associated with the hagoromo include the Japanese legend of [i]tennin[/i] (spirtual beings who wear hagoromo) and some folkloric stories set in China, for example, [[Orihime (tanabata)|]] and [[Hikoboshi]].

Buddhist deities' hagoromo-like shawls are called "天衣" (Chinese: [i]tian yi[/i], Japanese: [i]tenne[/i], [i]ten'e[/i], or [i]ten'i[/i]). On Danbooru, tian yi should be tagged as hagoromo for convenience. 

h4. See also

* [[Flowing dress (dq)|]] (a hagoromo-like item in [[Dragon Quest]])

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Tennin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennin
* "Wikipedia: Velificatio":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velificatio (a similar concept in classical Western art)
* "Wikipedia (JP): Legend of Hagoromo":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%BE%BD%E8%A1%A3%E4%BC%9D%E8%AA%AC
