title: exotic_(nikke)
body:
A squad in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] that consists of [[Crow (nikke)|]], [[Jackal (nikke)|]], and  [[Viper (nikke)|]].

A Nikke squad composed of ruffians from the slums at the outskirts of the Ark, the Outer Rim.

As a contingency plan, all members must wear a choker that will self-destruct if deemed necessary.

[spoiler]As of Chapter 39, [[Elysion Harper (Nikke)|]] has replaced the now-incarcerated Crow as the leader of Exotic due to Crow's crimes against the Ark.[/spoiler]

title: shiranui_flare_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of [[hololive]]'s [[Shiranui Flare]].

It consists of a blue [[detached collar]] with a [[red bowtie]], a [[skirt set]] consistsing of a [[white shirt|white]] [[criss-cross halter|criss-cross]] [[halter shirt]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], a [[cutout above navel]] and [[criss-cross back-straps]], and a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[bow skirt|bow]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], [[wide sleeves|wide]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[detached sleeves]],  [[white gloves|white]] [[half gloves]], [[white garter straps]] [[white thighhighs|thighhighs]] and [[blue shoes]].

Despite the name, this tag refers to her [i]current[/i] default costume, which she started using in December 12, 2021, and is her fourth chronologically. For the default costume she originally used when she first debuted, and the modified version she originally used for 3D streams, see [[Shiranui Flare (old design)]].

title: barghest_(fate)
body:
A hellhound fairy Saber-class Servant introduced in the Britain Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Despite her initial introductory title as Fairy Knight Gawain, she is not a genderbent version of [[Gawain (fate)|]].

In comparison to other female servants, she is [[tall female|unusually tall]], standing 10cm (4 inches) above Gawain himself at 190cm (6'3) and weighing 120kg (265lbs) due to her very [[muscular female|muscular build]] and [[huge breasts]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Melon22]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Inoue Marina]]

title: anila_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Character in [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i] who is loosely based on [[Anila (buddhism)]]. She was available during 2015, as it is was the year of the sheep.

This gentle lamb of a goddess abhors conflict and prays for world peace. She endured isolation for what seemed like an eternity, but now seeks out new lands, guided by the stars.

She has [[horns]], [[large breasts]], and [[yellow eyes]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with an [[ahoge]].

title: greenhouse
body:
A greenhouse is normally characterized by the following:

* A building largely made up out of framing and glass panels
* A building that has been made economically and with an eye for keeping costs low. 
* A building which main purpose is the growing of and the caring for plants
* Often a free-standing building not attached to other types of buildings

This is in contrast with a [[conservatory]], a building that is often confused with a greenhouse as the main purpose of a conservatory is to be used as a living space, with plants sometimes intermixed.

A few examples of a greenhouse are the following:

* A large building on a farm filled with rows and rows of plants being grown for consumption or sale.
* A small building in a private garden or "allotment garden":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allotment_(gardening)] used mainly for the growing of plants.
* A building that is of the same type of either of the two described above but is empty or used for the storage of other objects is still a greenhouse as well.
* A botanical garden can also be called a greenhouse although it often overlaps with a conservatory.
* A [[hydroponics]] garden wherein the plants are grown without soil, using instead nutrient water and another small stone (e.g. clay pellets) for rooting.

title: oberon_(fate)
body:
Servant introduced in the [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|British Lostbelt]] of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He is known as the King of the Fairies in medieval and Renaissance literature, and is best known as a character in [[William Shakespeare (fate)|]]'s play [[A Midsummer Night's Dream]]. He initially appears as a Ruler-class servant who is able to switch to Archer, Caster, and Rider classes at will, before being revealed as the first Pretender-class servant in the franchise. [spoiler]His true name is [b]Oberon Vortigern[/b], a servant summoned by the planet itself to destroy the British Lostbelt who is a fusion of the mythological Oberon, the Oberon from A Midsummer Night's Dream, and [[Artoria Pendragon (fate)|]]'s uncle Vortigern.[/spoiler]

His third ascension artwork is locked until players complete Avalon le Fae.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Umino Chika]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Toyonaga Toshiyuki]]

title: fujimaru_ritsuka_(male)
body:
The protagonist of [[Fate/Grand Order]] if selected as male.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[blue eyes]]. Usually seen wearing a [[Chaldea uniform]].

As he is a player character, he does not have much characterization within the game itself. However, he receives more personality in manga and anime adaptations. He also makes cameo appearances in the [i]Learn With Manga![/i] series, where he regularly makes passes at [[Astolfo (fate)|]] and is apparently the [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (Female)|female protagonist]]'s pretend pro-wrestling partner.

His appearance is based on [[Tohsaka Rin]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Shimazaki Nobunaga]]

title: rosemi_lovelock_(spy)
body:
The 5th and final [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Rosemi Lovelock]]. 

It's a dark [[blue suit]] with a [[gold trim]] over a [[grey vest]], a [[white shirt]] with [[frilled sleeves]] and [[pink necktie]], with [[blue pants]], dark [[red shoes|red]] [[high heels]] and [[black gloves]]. Rosemi also has a [[lollipop]] in her mouth and a [[heart]] under her right eye.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] is a [[bob cut]] with [[braided bangs]] on her left side and [[blunt bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering her right eye]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9457034: Profile

title: rosemi_lovelock
body:
A [[Nijisanji EN]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]], part of the second wave [[Obsydia (nijisanji)|]] and designed by [[Abandon Ranka]].

On August 12th, 2025, she "announced her graduation":[https://www.youtube.com/live/Lig0E72nj5c] on August 29th.

Rosemi is a [[medium hair]], [[multicolored eyes|multicolored]] [[brown eyes|brown]] and [[pink eyes|pink-eyed]], [[pink hair|pink-haired]] flower girl [spoilers]later revealed incarnation of [[Satan (mythology)|]][/spoilers] with a [[short sidetail]] hairstyle and [[thorns]] around her head.

title: tenochtitlan_(fate)
body:
Servant introduced in [[Nahui Mictlan (fate/grand order)|]] Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She initially appears as the Ruler-class servant [b]Tlaloc[/b] and the Berserker-class [b]Huitzilopochtli[/b] before being revealed as the Pretender-class servant Tenochtitlan, the embodiment of the Aztec capital.

Her third ascension is locked until players complete Nahui Mictlan. Her name is Nahuatl for "Among Prickly Pear (Cacti)".

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Saitou Hiroki]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Honda Mariko]]

title: quetzalcoatl_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]] first appearing in the [[Babylonia (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. A god from [[Aztec]] mythology who loves humans and grants them his blessings.

Quetzalcoatl is depicted as female [spoiler](due to the Aztec gods in Fate universe actually being alien parasites who take on human hosts)[/spoiler], and she loathes her fellow god [[Tezcatlipoca (fate)|]] due to their differing beliefs on human sacrifice. Loves [[luchador]] and inserts gratuitous English in her sentences (localized to Spanish in the English translation).

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Hiroe Rei]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Endou Aya]]

title: masters_of_the_universe
body:
[i][b]Masters of the Universe[/b][/i] (commonly abbreviated [i][b]MOTU[/b][/i] and sometimes referred to as [i][b]He-Man and the Masters of the Universe[/b][/i] or just [i][b]He-Man[/b][/i], after the lead hero) is a [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] American media franchise created by the "Mattel toy company":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mattel in the early 80s.

Although featuring a vast line-up of characters, the main premise revolves around the conflict between the heroic [[He-Man]] and the evil [[Skeletor]] on [[eternia_(planet)|planet Eternia]]. 

Since its initial launch, the franchise has spawned a variety of products, including six lines of [[action figure]]s, four animated television series, several comic series, and a live action feature film (The "Japanese title":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%9E%E3%82%B9%E3%82%BF%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BA/%E8%B6%85%E7%A9%BA%E3%81%AE%E8%A6%87%E8%80%85 is usually only used for the movie).

The first cartoon series was broadcasted from 1983 to 1985. It became extremely popular in several different countries. 

A second animated spin-off series called [[She-Ra Princess of Power|She-Ra: Princess of Power]] was released in 1985. It also became quite popular, but not as much as the first series. It was rebooted in 2018 as [[She-Ra and the Princesses of Power]].

Designer Roger Sweet claims to be the chief creator of He-Man and MOTU, although this is not officially acknowledged by Mattel and is disputed by some other contributors. The earliest storybooks and much of the original backstory were written by Donald F. Glut, while the final production sculpt of the very first 1982 He-Man [[action figure]] was done by Tony Guerrero.

title: double-barreled_shotgun
body:
A [[shotgun]] with 2 parallel barrels either aligned side by side (SxS) or over and under (O/U).

Commonly, they are operated with break-action and usually are [[sawed-off shotgun|sawed off]]. Early ones have two triggers, allowing firing either one or both shells at once while the later and modern models only have a single trigger capable of firing one and another in quick succession.

In media, they usually wielded in the wild west as coach guns, 18" to 24" barrels, but can also be seen during apocalypses like zombies or wastelands.
In games, [[Doom II]] marked it's debut as the Super Shotgun, a more devastating upgrade to the workhorse weapon, the shotgun, and has became a staple in the shooters genre.

title: artoria_pendragon_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A version of [[Saber (fate)|]] summoned as a Lancer-class servant in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She wields [[Rhongomyniad (fate)|Rhongomyniad]] instead of [[Excalibur (fate/stay night)|Excalibur]].

This version of Artoria is taller, possesses [[large breasts|larger breasts]], longer bangs ([[swept bangs|swept]] or [[hair between eyes|falling between her eyes]]), and longer [[sidelocks]]. Due to her larger breasts, she's often called 乳王 (Milk/Breast King) among the fanbase.

The reason for her more endowed appearance is because [spoilers]she's not affected by Excalibur's side effects that prevent its user from aging further.[/spoilers]

Her horse is named [[Dun Stallion (fate)|]]. And her breastplate is most likely modeled after a tournament (jousting) helmet called a "[i]Frog-mouth helm[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frog-mouth_helm, "[i]Stechhelm[/i]":https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stechhelm or "[i]Krötenkopfhelm[/i]":https://mittelalter.fandom.com/de/wiki/Krötenkopfhelm.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Ishida Akira]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Kawasumi Ayako]]

title: achilles_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant first seen in [[Fate/Apocrypha]] as the [b]Rider of "Red"[/b] servant of [[Cabik Pentel]]. The greatest hero of the Trojan War, and was responsible for slaying [[Hector (fate)|]]. When he was a child, his mother Thetis submerged his entire body into the river Styx to give him invulnerability, except for his heel where she held him. Achilles is thus killed by Hector's brother [[Paris (fate)|]] when he shot an arrow at his heel.

The term "Achilles' heel", meaning a weakness in someone who otherwise has a strong constitution, is attributed to this mythology.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Furukawa Makoto]]

title: chiron_(fate)
body:
The Archer of "Black" servant of [[Fiore Forvedge Yggdmillennia]] in [[Fate/Apocrypha]]. He appears as a [[horse boy]], though his true form as seen in [[Fate/Grand Order]] is a [[centaur]]. He is a divine spirit and demigod who was the teacher of many great Greek heroes, including [[Heracles (fate)|]], [[Jason (fate)|]], [[Castor (fate)|]], [[Asclepius (fate)|]], and [[Achilles (fate)|]]. Because he gave up his immortality, he is able to be summoned as a heroic spirit. He is the model for the [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]] constellation.

Not to be confused with [[Charon (fate)|]].

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Konoe Ototsugu]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]]

title: romani_archaman
body:
[[Fate/Grand Order]] character.

Chief medical officer at the [[Chaldea Security Organization]] and a very relaxed person. Becomes the acting director of the organization after the events of the [[Fuyuki (fate/grand order)|]] singularity. Friends with [[Leonardo da Vinci (Fate)|]] and is a devoted fan of [[Magi Mari|Magi☆Mari]].

[spoiler]He turns out to be the true Servant [[Solomon (fate)|Solomon]], who uses the wish gained by winning the Holy Grail War to incarnate himself as a human in order to experience all that he hadn't in life. He uses his final Noble Phantasm, Ars Nova, to erase himself from existence and give the heroes a fighting chance at defeating Goetia at the final battle in the Solomon singularity.[/spoiler]

Not to be confused with [[Chaldea no Mono]], who has orange eyes instead.

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actor:[/b] [[Suzumura Ken'ichi]]
